story:
Somme: Featured On

Here's the feature in the weekly news circulation.

Read what they had to say about it here.

Here's a link to their page covering this campaign.

 BOARDGAMELINKS

Here's a mirror to their link.

Here's their newsfeed.

 

Somme: The Story

The year is 1916. A great war rages across the world. “The war to end all wars” some call it and it seems to be living up to its name, for a more terrible yet strange war the mankind had not seen before.

It is definitely nothing like those that came before it, for here the men lie, waiting, almost peacefully, in the lines they have drawn. For months together, nothing has stirred over the now, black land. No bird flies over, nor any beast roams here. The silence is almost unbearable, as the men eat, sleep and go about their business in absolute monotony.

Suddenly, the frail sense of security is shattered by a deafening noise, as a bombshell explodes nearby, causing the men to drop their jobs and scuttle for cover. One explosion is followed by another and another and another… and so the pounding goes on and on… for days and days… till all nerves are frayed and every muscle is jittery. Just when they were beginning to think that it would never stop, it ends, as abruptly, as it had started.

Deafened by the onslaught on their ears, the soldiers strain to hear, fearful of that which is to follow. Soon enough, they hear a distant pattering of feet, getting closer and closer or are they? Surely, it is the sound of gunfire that they hear now or are their ears still playing tricks on them? The men arise as if from a great slumber and peer over the parapet. What they see is incredulous, for what was earlier a barren wasteland is now a rising sea before them. Their knuckles whiten as they tighten their grips over their weapons and wait for the incoming tide to draw closer, nay, wash over them.

It is clear, that thousands will die this day and whether or not they themselves would survive, will ultimately depend on your wisdom, as their commander and the support of the brothers, by their sides. So take charge and stand fast. For the empire!   

 

Somme: The Game

Contents: Beside the Rule Sheet, each Game Pack includes a set of 66 Cards.

  1. 16 X Personnel Cards (all unique):
    1. 8 X British Personnel Cards
    2. 8 X German Personnel Cards
  2. 4 X Hardship Cards (all unique)
    1. 1 X Battle Wound Card
    2. 1 X Infectious Disease Card
    3. 1 X Shell Shock Card
    4. 1 X Trench Foot Card
  3. 4 X Event Cards (all unique)
    1. 1 X Listening Post Card
    2. 1 X Observation Balloon Card
    3. 1 X Stand To Card
    4. 1 X Strategic Retreat Card
  4. 42 X Attack-Defence Cards (12 unique)
    1. 4 X Bayonet Charge – Wire Fence Cards
    2. 4 X Grenade Throw – Run Away Cards
    3. 4 X Rifle Shot – Sandbag Wall Cards
    4. 4 X MG Round – Pill Box Cards
    5. 4 X Mortar Fire – Steel Helmet Cards
    6. 4 X Sniper Fire – Periscope Cards
    7. 4 X Flame Thrower – Focus Fire Cards
    8. 4 X Mining/Undermining – Listening Device Cards
    9. 4 X Poison Gas – Gas Mask Cards
    10. 2 X Artillery Barrage – Deep Dugout Cards
    11. 2 X Bombing Run – Fighter Support Cards
    12. 2 X Tank Manoeuvres – Anti-Tank Mine Cards

Setup: To play, each player chooses and commandeers a faction, the British or the German, consisting of a squad of 8 soldiers that are laid out in a row on the table. Rest of the cards are shuffled and 15 each, are distributed to the players, of which 8, are assigned to the soldiers already on the table while the rest of the 7 are held in the player’s hand as reserve.

Strategy: Each of the fighting units under the player’s command is unique, with different loadouts and a susceptibility to specific hardships that may be exploited by the other player by playing the hardship cards. Additionally, the players’ squad as a whole, might also be affected by certain events that may be triggered by playing the event cards.

Objective: The object of the game is simple, eliminate the rival faction before they eliminate you.

Turn Mechanics: The players alternate between attacking, with a combination of Personnel Cards and assigned Attack-Defence Cards from the table and defending, with a combination of Personnel Cards and assigned Attack-Defence Cards from the table or the reserve Attack-Defence Cards from the player’s hand. According to the unique player interaction that ensues, the soldiers may either loose morale, possibly even leading to elimination or on a few rarer occasions, gain morale, coming out stronger to face another sapping day in the trenches. Both the player’s soldiers are resupplied at the end of each turn by drawing replacement cards and so the grinding war continues, till only one side remains standing.

Note: The aforesaid is only a brief summary of the gameplay and rules, meant as a quick overview for the contributors and further clarifications shall be available in the detailed Rule Sheet accompanying the game.

 

Somme We Need & Somme You Get

  • All the funding raised by this campaign, will be used towards getting the game mass produced and into your eager hands as soon possible. With your help and contribution we hope to hit the campaign goal running. 
  • We have kept the perks as straight forward and contributor friendly, as possible. For a mere $8 (+ shipping) [discounted price of $7 (+ discounted shipping) for early birds], you get an all-inclusive game pack that can be played with a friend, gifted to a sibling or bequeathed to your grandchildren. For a discounted price of $14 (+ discounted shipping), you get two. It’s as simple as that! What's more, so as to create even more value for our contributors, each subsequent perk would now include the previous perk i.e. Mention in Dispatches perk includes Commendation Card perk while Campaign Medal, War Medal and War Decoration perks includes both Commendation Card and Mention in Dispatches perks.
  • Since the game will be locally manufactured, we are passing on, the benefit of the savings in the shipping costs, to our Indian contributors, with shipping at lower rates within India.

 

Somme More Ways You Can Help

  • While money does make the world go round, it is just one of the several ways by which interested folks can help. Even if you can’t contribute, you can always get the word out and make some noise about this campaign. After all, it is interesting gossip that makes the world sit up and take note!
  • May we also remind you to make generous use of the Indiegogo share tools!

 

Somme: The Project

This being our first crowdfunding campaign, Somme: Life in the Saps is very special for us, here at reCreatives. As the name suggests, we are an indie creative industry startup, of creatives based out of India, dedicated to recreating epical scenarios into unique recreational experiences. Though young and naive, we are very passionate about what we do and with this project, we have tried to present a fresh adaptation to the subject.

With a focus on functionality, while designing and developing the game, our endeavour has always been to emulate a sense of intense realism that highlights the vagaries of the Great War and the heroism of those who braved them, so as to bring you an unadulterated, truly immersive, simulative gameplay experience. We have also tried our best to keep the gameplay as well as art design, simple yet engaging, without compromising on the strategic elements, so as not to bog down the players with inessential complexity that leads away from the gaming experience. To that end, we have used original postcard portraits of real World War I veterans with actual army rank insignias to represent morale and simple universally identifiable icons for weapons, tools, defensive structures, hardships and events. This has also helped us to keep a low production cost, so as to ensure that it is a minimal burden on our patrons and so that the game remains accessible to each and every gaming enthusiast and history aficionado, around the world. Our choice of choosing Indiegogo for this crowdfunding campaign is also a step in that direction, as we believe that it is one of the most inclusive and democratic platforms of its kind.

We hope you like the final product and that it meets your expectations, so as to prove us worthy of your immense faith in us.

Lastly, we request you to keep showering us with your love and support and in return, we promise to bring you many more adventures, some of which are already in the pipeline. Being a young organisation, we are actively on the lookout for talented collaborators/illustrators with complementary skillsets for our future projects. Please feel free to approach us privately for a candid discussion with a clear outline of what you think, can be achieved together, in case, you are equally passionate about such work. Business enquiries from retailers/publishers are also welcome.

 

Somme Risks & Challenges

  • Since admittedly, this is one of our first gigs. We are taking small cautious steps, one at a time. Believe us, we are in this for the long run. It is your trust, more than your money, that we want to earn.
  • Though we already have a completely functional prototype with final artwork et. all, the final product is subject to modifications and improvements, wherever necessary, in order to improve upon your gameplay experience and therefore, it may vary substantially from the representations herein.
  • The most important phase for us is manufacturing. To that end, we have already made enquiries with certain local manufacturers, here in India and will be partnering with a reputed card game manufacturer, with an emphasis on quality.
  • Soon after, comes shipping. To get those freshly minted decks to you, we will be partnering with a reliable international shipper. Again, we have made a few enquiries and will be choosing the most cost effective option available.
  • Despite all planning, things do sometimes go sideways. While we will try our level best to deliver on our promises in a time bound manner, we ourselves, would also be relying on complete third parties for the further stages. Therefore, we do apologies in advance for any inadvertent and unexpected delays that might creep in during execution and request you to be patient and hang in there, in case there is trouble with customs etc.

 

Somme Credits

We would like to give a shout-out to Ms. Era Kaila and Mr. Atul Anand of MAG Initiatives who along with Mr. Abhinav made for a sporting audience to an impromptu debut demonstration of the game at the India Gaming Show, 2017. Seriously, if any of your children hate Maths as thoroughly as we do, you should definitely check out their brilliant games.

More than anything, we would like to thank our parents for their unwavering support and blessings, at every stage of our lives. Everything that we are today, is all due to them. We would also like to thank our siblings, who induced substantial skill development as our first playmates and game masters. If not for their encouragement, we might not have found the perseverance to rise to the challenge against all odds.

Last but not the least, we would like to thank you, the contributor, from the bottom of our heart, for your most generous patronage of this project and without whom, it would have remained a mere possibility in this huge multiverse.

That’s all for now folks! Thanks for being awesome!
story_txt:
Somme: Featured OnHere's the feature in the weekly news circulation.Read what they had to say about it here.Here's a link to their page covering this campaign. BOARDGAMELINKSHere's a mirror to their link.Here's their newsfeed. Somme: The StoryThe year is 1916. A great war rages across the world. “The war to end all wars” some call it and it seems to be living up to its name, for a more terrible yet strange war the mankind had not seen before.It is definitely nothing like those that came before it, for here the men lie, waiting, almost peacefully, in the lines they have drawn. For months together, nothing has stirred over the now, black land. No bird flies over, nor any beast roams here. The silence is almost unbearable, as the men eat, sleep and go about their business in absolute monotony.Suddenly, the frail sense of security is shattered by a deafening noise, as a bombshell explodes nearby, causing the men to drop their jobs and scuttle for cover. One explosion is followed by another and another and another… and so the pounding goes on and on… for days and days… till all nerves are frayed and every muscle is jittery. Just when they were beginning to think that it would never stop, it ends, as abruptly, as it had started.Deafened by the onslaught on their ears, the soldiers strain to hear, fearful of that which is to follow. Soon enough, they hear a distant pattering of feet, getting closer and closer or are they? Surely, it is the sound of gunfire that they hear now or are their ears still playing tricks on them? The men arise as if from a great slumber and peer over the parapet. What they see is incredulous, for what was earlier a barren wasteland is now a rising sea before them. Their knuckles whiten as they tighten their grips over their weapons and wait for the incoming tide to draw closer, nay, wash over them.It is clear, that thousands will die this day and whether or not they themselves would survive, will ultimately depend on your wisdom, as their commander and the support of the brothers, by their sides. So take charge and stand fast. For the empire!    Somme: The GameContents: Beside the Rule Sheet, each Game Pack includes a set of 66 Cards.
16 X Personnel Cards (all unique):
8 X British Personnel Cards
8 X German Personnel Cards


4 X Hardship Cards (all unique)
1 X Battle Wound Card
1 X Infectious Disease Card
1 X Shell Shock Card
1 X Trench Foot Card


4 X Event Cards (all unique)
1 X Listening Post Card
1 X Observation Balloon Card
1 X Stand To Card
1 X Strategic Retreat Card


42 X Attack-Defence Cards (12 unique)
4 X Bayonet Charge – Wire Fence Cards
4 X Grenade Throw – Run Away Cards
4 X Rifle Shot – Sandbag Wall Cards
4 X MG Round – Pill Box Cards
4 X Mortar Fire – Steel Helmet Cards
4 X Sniper Fire – Periscope Cards
4 X Flame Thrower – Focus Fire Cards
4 X Mining/Undermining – Listening Device Cards
4 X Poison Gas – Gas Mask Cards
2 X Artillery Barrage – Deep Dugout Cards
2 X Bombing Run – Fighter Support Cards
2 X Tank Manoeuvres – Anti-Tank Mine Cards


Setup: To play, each player chooses and commandeers a faction, the British or the German, consisting of a squad of 8 soldiers that are laid out in a row on the table. Rest of the cards are shuffled and 15 each, are distributed to the players, of which 8, are assigned to the soldiers already on the table while the rest of the 7 are held in the player’s hand as reserve.Strategy: Each of the fighting units under the player’s command is unique, with different loadouts and a susceptibility to specific hardships that may be exploited by the other player by playing the hardship cards. Additionally, the players’ squad as a whole, might also be affected by certain events that may be triggered by playing the event cards.Objective: The object of the game is simple, eliminate the rival faction before they eliminate you.Turn Mechanics: The players alternate between attacking, with a combination of Personnel Cards and assigned Attack-Defence Cards from the table and defending, with a combination of Personnel Cards and assigned Attack-Defence Cards from the table or the reserve Attack-Defence Cards from the player’s hand. According to the unique player interaction that ensues, the soldiers may either loose morale, possibly even leading to elimination or on a few rarer occasions, gain morale, coming out stronger to face another sapping day in the trenches. Both the player’s soldiers are resupplied at the end of each turn by drawing replacement cards and so the grinding war continues, till only one side remains standing.Note: The aforesaid is only a brief summary of the gameplay and rules, meant as a quick overview for the contributors and further clarifications shall be available in the detailed Rule Sheet accompanying the game. Somme We Need & Somme You Get
All the funding raised by this campaign, will be used towards getting the game mass produced and into your eager hands as soon possible. With your help and contribution we hope to hit the campaign goal running. 
We have kept the perks as straight forward and contributor friendly, as possible. For a mere $8 (+ shipping) [discounted price of $7 (+ discounted shipping) for early birds], you get an all-inclusive game pack that can be played with a friend, gifted to a sibling or bequeathed to your grandchildren. For a discounted price of $14 (+ discounted shipping), you get two. It’s as simple as that! What's more, so as to create even more value for our contributors, each subsequent perk would now include the previous perk i.e. Mention in Dispatches perk includes Commendation Card perk while Campaign Medal, War Medal and War Decoration perks includes both Commendation Card and Mention in Dispatches perks.
Since the game will be locally manufactured, we are passing on, the benefit of the savings in the shipping costs, to our Indian contributors, with shipping at lower rates within India.
 Somme More Ways You Can Help
While money does make the world go round, it is just one of the several ways by which interested folks can help. Even if you can’t contribute, you can always get the word out and make some noise about this campaign. After all, it is interesting gossip that makes the world sit up and take note!
May we also remind you to make generous use of the Indiegogo share tools!
 Somme: The ProjectThis being our first crowdfunding campaign, Somme: Life in the Saps is very special for us, here at reCreatives. As the name suggests, we are an indie creative industry startup, of creatives based out of India, dedicated to recreating epical scenarios into unique recreational experiences. Though young and naive, we are very passionate about what we do and with this project, we have tried to present a fresh adaptation to the subject.With a focus on functionality, while designing and developing the game, our endeavour has always been to emulate a sense of intense realism that highlights the vagaries of the Great War and the heroism of those who braved them, so as to bring you an unadulterated, truly immersive, simulative gameplay experience. We have also tried our best to keep the gameplay as well as art design, simple yet engaging, without compromising on the strategic elements, so as not to bog down the players with inessential complexity that leads away from the gaming experience. To that end, we have used original postcard portraits of real World War I veterans with actual army rank insignias to represent morale and simple universally identifiable icons for weapons, tools, defensive structures, hardships and events. This has also helped us to keep a low production cost, so as to ensure that it is a minimal burden on our patrons and so that the game remains accessible to each and every gaming enthusiast and history aficionado, around the world. Our choice of choosing Indiegogo for this crowdfunding campaign is also a step in that direction, as we believe that it is one of the most inclusive and democratic platforms of its kind.We hope you like the final product and that it meets your expectations, so as to prove us worthy of your immense faith in us.Lastly, we request you to keep showering us with your love and support and in return, we promise to bring you many more adventures, some of which are already in the pipeline. Being a young organisation, we are actively on the lookout for talented collaborators/illustrators with complementary skillsets for our future projects. Please feel free to approach us privately for a candid discussion with a clear outline of what you think, can be achieved together, in case, you are equally passionate about such work. Business enquiries from retailers/publishers are also welcome. Somme Risks & Challenges
Since admittedly, this is one of our first gigs. We are taking small cautious steps, one at a time. Believe us, we are in this for the long run. It is your trust, more than your money, that we want to earn.
Though we already have a completely functional prototype with final artwork et. all, the final product is subject to modifications and improvements, wherever necessary, in order to improve upon your gameplay experience and therefore, it may vary substantially from the representations herein.
The most important phase for us is manufacturing. To that end, we have already made enquiries with certain local manufacturers, here in India and will be partnering with a reputed card game manufacturer, with an emphasis on quality.
Soon after, comes shipping. To get those freshly minted decks to you, we will be partnering with a reliable international shipper. Again, we have made a few enquiries and will be choosing the most cost effective option available.
Despite all planning, things do sometimes go sideways. While we will try our level best to deliver on our promises in a time bound manner, we ourselves, would also be relying on complete third parties for the further stages. Therefore, we do apologies in advance for any inadvertent and unexpected delays that might creep in during execution and request you to be patient and hang in there, in case there is trouble with customs etc.
 Somme CreditsWe would like to give a shout-out to Ms. Era Kaila and Mr. Atul Anand of MAG Initiatives who along with Mr. Abhinav made for a sporting audience to an impromptu debut demonstration of the game at the India Gaming Show, 2017. Seriously, if any of your children hate Maths as thoroughly as we do, you should definitely check out their brilliant games.More than anything, we would like to thank our parents for their unwavering support and blessings, at every stage of our lives. Everything that we are today, is all due to them. We would also like to thank our siblings, who induced substantial skill development as our first playmates and game masters. If not for their encouragement, we might not have found the perseverance to rise to the challenge against all odds.Last but not the least, we would like to thank you, the contributor, from the bottom of our heart, for your most generous patronage of this project and without whom, it would have remained a mere possibility in this huge multiverse.That’s all for now folks! Thanks for being awesome!

story:
We are Martin Neill (bring it back guy / football game nerd), Alan Stewart (board game guru), Giles Hunter (games publisher of over 200 titles including the original Brian Clough's Football Fortunes) and David Hall (originator and creator of Brian Clough's Football Fortunes.)

In 2017 we got together to discuss the possibility of a new, modernised version of what was Marty's favourite childhood game. By 2018 we had a community of over 5000 people on Facebook excited at the prospect and by mid August we'd closed a £20,000 crowdfunding campaign that will allow us to make the new game. 

Beyond the Kickstarter we've had a number of people asking how they can get the game and so we're here on IndieGoGo Indemand to allow those who missed out to get in on the game! We're also continuing the ability to have a Personalised Coach Card in the game with the backer's name (or a name of their choosing) printed on it. This was hugely popular last time around and so there's only a further 15 available this time around!
 

How To Play Football Fortunes
 

As the manager of your chosen club you're responsible for everything from player recruitment to managing staff, from formations to finances as well as managing the various crises the game can throw at you. The board game part of Football Fortunes is where you buy, sell, transfer and loan players as well as get sponsorship, visit your academy, hire staff and much much more. The computer app part takes care of all of the messy stuff from working out the match fixtures and results to totting up the league tables and even rolling the dice for you.    

Watch our video below for a run through of how to play the new Football Fortunes game. From signing players, to transfer windows, how to use the Coach card and Scout card, what are Manager's Luck and Selection Problems cards and much more. 
 


 

If that's not enough we have a full two season playthrough of our latest prototype of the game available to watch below. This video has it all from the board to the how the app is used, to formations, tactics, strategies and what amazing things can happen if you pray to Bob (who might be Bob Bolder and if you know who he was you're likely a fan of the original game!)

We're joined by Rory Kelly our agent and Nick Hamilton who's coding the new app for a full two season playthrough of the game. If you have questions please get in touch in the comments but almost everything that can happen in the game is in the video below.

Worth noting also that neither Nick nor Rory had played the game before...
 


 

We've been playing Football Fortunes for over thirty years and it has never got old in all of that time. From being kids, to teenagers and eventually (sort of!) adults we've always found something to love in the game and hope that the new game can build on the genius of the original and bring joy to a whole new generation of gamers. After all football is simple really, it's people together. 
 

Why Football Fortunes? What's different?
 


 

From the groundbreaking 1982 classic Kevin Tom’s Football Manager to modern day Football Manager football management games have always been long, lonely affairs right? 

Wrong!

Brian Clough’s Football Fortunes tore up the rulebook in the mid 80s by uniquely combining the best elements of board games with a computer programme. For football gaming fans, the game had it all. Not only did you have the highs and lows of managing your favourite football club but you could crush your mates on the way to winning the Cup, buy their favourite player from under their nose or even lead Luton Town to unlikely European glory all without leaving your living room! 

In the 32 years since Brian Clough’s Football Fortunes was released a lot has changed. Hairlines, waistlines, technology, the world itself and most definitely football. From transfer windows to Super Sundays, bungs to Bosmans, the Premier League itself and the Champions League the landscape has changed a lot. Not least the obscene amounts of money and of course, not least, the players themselves. 

Football Fortunes 2019 brings football management gaming into the social setting once more with modern football rules and players, for football fans of all ages. The game emulates the highs and lows of football management, with managers having to out-think and out manoeuvre their opponents to win. Choose from multiple strategies. React best to a crisis. Stave off bankruptcy. Sign the best players. The skillset required to succeed will be varied and the hurdles challenging, just like they are in the real world!

Building a Dream Team

Fast forward nearly thirty years and I found myself picking up a copy of Cloughies on eBay. When it arrived it was in mint condition. I loved every second of carefully tearing the player cards, reading through the rules and messaging my now 40 something mates to see if they fancied a game.

We played it and it had lost none of its sparkle. Watching my mates transfixed by the old school vidiprinter, celebrating wildly when they won a trophy and bantering each other to within an inch of their lives I knew I had to try to bring the game back.

I started a Facebook page and within a month it had more than 1000 fans all talking about the original game and asking questions about the remake. One of the guys on the page said that he could introduce me to the guy who published Cloughies. And so he did!

Giles Hunter is the former owner of CDS Software and the publisher of Brian Clough’s Football Fortunes among many other hugely successful game titles such as Colossus Chess and Steve Davis Snooker. Giles was hugely receptive to the idea of creating a modern version of Cloughies and better still he was still good friends with David Hall the creator and visionary behind the original game. 

I made the hop over from Belfast to Donny, as Giles and David call Doncaster, on a hot day in the summer of 2017 with a bunch of ideas under my arm. The guys waxed lyrical about Cloughies, telling the tales of how it came to be, swerving responsibility for the legendary Liverpool striker John Aldridge being a 1 star player in the game (I’m gonna fix that some day) and much more, including how the original game had sold nearly 200,000 copies from England to Australia.

We agreed that bringing it back with a modernised version sounded like a great idea and set to work.

Nearly two years on and the game is now becoming a reality once more!
 

Crowdsourcing the Player Ratings

 


We did over 400 public player votes on our Facebook page, asking our community to rate Premier League players from 1-5 stars based on their ability. We had some great fun as fans of rival teams tried to vote down players from teams they didn't like but overall we got a very balanced set of players. From the obvious 5 stars like Mo Salah and Sergio Aguero to the barrel scrapers like Saido Berahino and Vincent Janssen at the other end of the talent spectrum, the ratings were pretty much what we'd expected. 

Then we removed one star players after a number of play tests, they were simply frustrating in transfer windows and auctions and annoying to get rid of from manager's squads as no one wanted to buy them. In the end we decided to take them out of the game altogether, introducing Youth Players instead which has been a great success we're pleased to say!
 

What's in the box?
 

The game starts, like the real world, with a summer transfer window allowing managers to bid on the next player cards in the deck with the highest bidder winning. Players are split into two types; Professionals and Youth Players. Professional players are rated from 2-5 stars depending on their ability while Youth Players begin with no rating and are coached to become star players. 

All managers will begin the game with a 12 star defence (goalkeeper + defenders) and a 12 star attack (midfielders + attackers) and with two unrated Youth Players on the bench who can be upgraded as the game progresses. Players can be bought in free agent auctions throughout the game, can be acquired via luck cards from Selection Problems and Managers Luck, can be Bosman Free Transfers or even bought from other managers as each manager has a transfer and loan list. 

Youth Players are brand new in the new game and replace the Utility Players from the original. Youth Players can be recruited by hiring a Scout, a visit to your Academy or via luck cards. They can be upgraded throughout the game, using the Coach.

Each player starts the game with a 1 star Coach. The coach can be upgraded as the game progresses either via landing on the Manage Staff square or via certain cards that can be drawn by landing on Manager's Luck for example. 

The Coach is a very important addition to the new game in that his rating (from 1 to 5 stars) gets added to the overall team rating for matches as well as being the amount that Youth Players can be upgraded when the opportunity arises to do so. So if for example you have a 3 star Coach and you have the chance to upgrade a Youth Player he can be upgraded by 3 stars, for a fee of course of £20m per star.
 

Master Tactics and Strategy
 

Managers must choose their players (usually by the highest rated in each position), their team's formation from 7 different formations and how to play either defensively or in an attacking style.  

A typical team layout in a 4-4-3 formation

If for example you choose to 'do a Mourinho' and park the bus in a defensive strategy you could set up with 6 defenders (in a 5-3-2 formation) and add your Coach to your defence to make a very solid defence likely at the expense of a weaker attack unless you have a very strong squad.

Conversely you could play an uber attacking formation of 4-2-4 for example and add your Coach's rating to your attack hoping that your goals scored outweigh the goals you might ship at the back.  The stronger your playing squad the greater chance you have of course of successfully using different tactics to win matches. And if you want to win the big trophies you'll need it a big and talented squad, just like the real world!

The new Football Fortunes game offers multiple strategies and ways to win however of course each strategy has its risks! Run out of money and you're out of the game, and there are only a limited amount of Youth Players available meaning other managers can block you from buying them. In reality, just like the real world, the best managers will be able to balance a mix of seasoned pros and youth all the way to phenomenal success. 

Will you try a Man City or Chelsea style moneybags approach and buy everyone in sight, a Liverpool style Moneyball philosophy where you sell big players and reinvest wisely or try to raise a team of superstars from the youth ranks like Manchester United’s famous Class of 92? 

All of these approaches are possible and all are up to you! And you get to beat your friends and family on the way to glory too, which is the real win!

Football Fortunes is coming back before Xmas, check out our pledges to find out how you can get in the game...

story:
Could not find the dice for your dice game? Lost one of the needed dice? Annoyed at dice dropping off a table? Tired of summing up the value of several dice? Have physical difficulty rolling normal dice?  

U-DICE  

Introducing U-Dice, an universal electronic dice for most dice games. It could have up to 6 dice at one roll, with each die be 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8, 10,12, 20, 24, 30 or 100 faces.

                                       

                                       

U-DICE has 6 sets of the following dice:

The d10 die has the value from 1 to 10. The percentile die (d%) has the value from 1 to 100, so there is no need for two dice with one represents units and the other tens. The fudge die has the value of -1, 0, 1, and is listed as (F3) to distinguish it from normal d3 which is listed as (3).  


Select the dice

There are 2 buttons on the back of the U-Dice for selecting how many dice (1 ~ 6) you need and the sides for each die (d2, d3, d4, d5, d6, d8, d10, d12, d20, d24, d30, d%, fudge d3).

Each dice setting is saved to one preset. There are up to 5 presets available for you to save. Every time when you make a dice setting and save it to one preset, that preset becomes the current preset.

During game, you could easily press the Preset Selection button once to change to the next preset, or press it several times to change to other available presets. If there are only 2 saved presets, you could toggle between these 2 presets by only one button press. 

Roll the dice

U-DICE uses a sensitive vibration sensor, so you could easily push, tap or shake it to roll the dice, the rolling screen will be displayed for 1 second followed by the roll result.

Roll result

When U-DICE is set to 1d6, 2d6, or 3d6, the d6 die is displayed with pips instead of number.

For all other cases, each die will be displayed with its roll value inside its die box, while the die sides is displayed to the lower left corner of the die box. 

The total value of all the dice except percentile dice is displayed on the top for easy recognition. 

If more than 1 percentile dice are set, only the first one is displayed on the top.

Specifications

Perks

Timeline

Why Indiegogo

We have already successfully raised more than $20,000 from Kickstarter within 10 days, but there are still demands on U-DICE after the campaign ends, so we decided to launch the same project here with Indiegogo. For all of you who missed the Kickstarter campaign, and who are new to U-DICE but want to grab one, now is the time to back us.

If you can't back at this time, there are still ways to help. Please share this project via email, social media, and word of mouth to tell your friends about our campaign. Thank you!

Risks and challenges

Since our prototype is a fully functional one, along with the fund we already raised from Kickstarter, the concern is not if you could get your U-DICE, but a matter of when. U-DICE is not that complicated and the needed electronic components are plenty of supply. But there is always the possibility of delays due to things beyond our control at the manufacturer’s facility. We will keep you closely updated with the progress and work hard to deliver the product on schedule.
story_txt:
Could not find the dice for your dice game? Lost one of the needed dice? Annoyed at dice dropping off a table? Tired of summing up the value of several dice? Have physical difficulty rolling normal dice?  U-DICE  Introducing U-Dice, an universal electronic dice for most dice games. It could have up to 6 dice at one roll, with each die be 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8, 10,12, 20, 24, 30 or 100 faces.                                                                              
                                                  Push, tap or shake to roll U-DICE
U-DICE has 6 sets of the following dice:


The d10 die has the value from 1 to 10. The percentile die (d%) has the value from 1 to 100, so there is no need for two dice with one represents units and the other tens. The fudge die has the value of -1, 0, 1, and is listed as (F3) to distinguish it from normal d3 which is listed as (3).  Select the dice
There are 2 buttons on the back of the U-Dice for selecting how many dice (1 ~ 6) you need and the sides for each die (d2, d3, d4, d5, d6, d8, d10, d12, d20, d24, d30, d%, fudge d3).
                                                                                              Preset set screen
Each dice setting is saved to one preset. There are up to 5 presets available for you to save. Every time when you make a dice setting and save it to one preset, that preset becomes the current preset.
                                                               Change to preset 1 (3d6) with one button press
During game, you could easily press the Preset Selection button once to change to the next preset, or press it several times to change to other available presets. If there are only 2 saved presets, you could toggle between these 2 presets by only one button press. 
Roll the dice
U-DICE uses a sensitive vibration sensor, so you could easily push, tap or shake it to roll the dice, the rolling screen will be displayed for 1 second followed by the roll result.
                                                                                    Push, tap, or shake to roll U-DICE
Roll result

When U-DICE is set to 1d6, 2d6, or 3d6, the d6 die is displayed with pips instead of number.
For all other cases, each die will be displayed with its roll value inside its die box, while the die sides is displayed to the lower left corner of the die box. 
The total value of all the dice except percentile dice is displayed on the top for easy recognition. 
If more than 1 percentile dice are set, only the first one is displayed on the top.
Specifications



Perks






Stretch goals






When U-DICE is powered on, a startup screen with the U-DICE logo is displayed for 1 second. For personal edition, your personal message will be displayed under the U-DICE logo on that screen, such as "Special for <your name>", etc. If this stretch goal is unlocked, you could specify your own message in the survey after the campaign ends.



The default black panel for the U-DICE display could be replaced easily with other panels. If this stretch goal is unlocked, you do not select only one color, you get all the colors! That means you will have all the 8 beautiful color panels for your U-DICE, change it whenever you want. 




Every U-DICE will have a sweet home.


Timeline



Why Indiegogo

We have already successfully raised more than $20,000 from Kickstarter within 10 days, but there are still demands on U-DICE after the campaign ends, so we decided to launch the same project here with Indiegogo. For all of you who missed the Kickstarter campaign, and who are new to U-DICE but want to grab one, now is the time to back us.




If you can't back at this time, there are still ways to help. Please share this project via email, social media, and word of mouth to tell your friends about our campaign. Thank you!


Risks and challengesSince our prototype is a fully functional one, along with the fund we already raised from Kickstarter, the concern is not if you could get your U-DICE, but a matter of when. U-DICE is not that complicated and the needed electronic components are plenty of supply. But there is always the possibility of delays due to things beyond our control at the manufacturer’s facility. We will keep you closely updated with the progress and work hard to deliver the product on schedule.

story:
Short Summary

This Mega Adventure includes a booklet of spell traps which can be incorporated into your own campaign adventures. Further, the included novella gives a 77W look at a band of adventurers as they navigate this very dungeon. The added value is another nod to old school works.

This adventure is designed to be challenging. The dungeon is ancient, partially rebuilt, repurposed through the ages, but now holds ties to an ancient desert goddess, ambitious mages, remnant magic from past and powerful illusionists, and areas of mystery. What, why, and other questions to ponder as you work through the tapestry...

What We Need & What You Get

The funding raised in this campaign will help us produce the final edition of this mega adventure along with maps and support for AD&D, D&D5e, 77Worlds, and Dragonscales FRPG.

  • Forgotten Dungeon 11x17 Maps
  • Forgotten Dungeon Map Booklet
  • FSC PDF Newsletter
  • Spell Trap booklet for AD&D/D20/D&D 5e
  • The Forgotten Dungeon 100+ page book
  • Mirror Mirror Adventure (100+ pages)
  • Spell Trap book for Dragonscales RPG
  • Spell Traps for 77 Worlds RPG
  • PDF Map Booklet
  • PDF The Forgotten Dungeon

Risks & Challenges

The writing for the Forgotten Dungeon is done, The art is done, Darlene's wonderful cover art is in hand along with Diesel's dungeon maps. Prototypes have been produced and a few sold at Garycon. Once we fund, we will complete the final product layout and send it off to the printer. The Adventure currently (before final layout) stands at 108 pages with maps. We will also begin work in July (before this KS ends) on Mirror Mirror, along with Dragonscales RPG and D&D 5e conversions depending on stretch goals achieved. Everything should ship before years end.

story:
THE WAR HAS JUST BEGUN

After its first major success on Kickstarter, and 3 years of development, Deep War is now ready to expand and reach the ambitious goal of recreating all the main factions, and the units, involved in the Second World War.

We need your support to keep advancing! 

With two full armies already complete: Wehrmacht  and U.S. Armed Forces, we are now planning to release the Vooruzhonnyye Sily SSSR (Russia) and the Dai-Nippon Teikoku Rikugun (Japan), followed by the British Armed Forces and the Forze armate del Regno d'Italia, all this in the following 2 years, for a total of 800+ unique cards.

Each faction has its own characteristics, uniqueness and playstyle, as well as colorful and extremely accurate illustrations.

 

THE GAME

Choose your faction, one general, build your deck using every possible unit and manage the supply system. Your goal is to destroy the enemy commander.

Each card has combat values and unique skills to recall the true essence of the real counterpart. Discover how they work, find their synergies and unleash your strategy against the enemy.

 

 

From 2 up to 6 players, will compete for glory. Create your faction with 2 other friends, and fight against 3 other commanders. Take control of each branch or be the General of the Army, the Air Chief Marshal or the Admiral.

Beside the game there is a world which will be greater and greater, where you will find curiosities, historical facts, the always beloved datasheets and many “Did you know?” cards to feed your curiosity.

 

The game will be available in: English, Italian, German, French

 

WHAT YOU WILL GET

You can choose from 2 main boxes. The classic cardboard box, or the wooden crate.

The old fashion military wooden box is handmade and it will hold everything you need with undisputed style. It has rope handles, leather hinges, a steel latch and fire stamps for the numbers and markings.

The wooden crate is available for the Battle Hardened and Living Legend perks.

 

INCLUDED IN EVERY BOX (set for 2 players):

  • Wehrmacht and U.S. Armed Forces
  • x170 Playable cards (63x88mm - 320 gsm)
  • x6 Commanders
    • Wehrmacht: Erwin Rommel, Hermann Göring, Karl Dönitz
    • U.S. Armed Forces: George Patton, Henry Arnold, Chester Nimitz
  • x2 Wooden Manpower trays
  • x2 Faction bags
  • x68 Colored and printed wooden tokens
  • x46 "Did you know?" cards 
  • x2 Faction dice
  • x1 Field manual (Illustrated instructions, 36 pages)
  • x1 Expandable Datasheets binder with curiosities, data and unit analysis (46 pages)
  • x2 Reminder cards
  • x2 Damage cards

 

ADD-ON LIST

  • Additional wooden crate (You will have the game split into 2 different faction crates. Crates can be stacked on top of each other)
    (€15/$17)

 

  • Complete Expansion set (216 cards + 6 Commanders)
    (€48/$54)
    • Wehrmacht - Steel Fury (Heinz Guderian)
    • Wehrmacht - Birds of Prey (Albert Kesselring)
    • Wehrmacht - Z-Plan (Erich Raeder)
    • U.S. - Shock and Awe (Omar Bradley)
    • U.S. - Strategic Destruction (Carl Spaatz)
    • U.S. - Grand Battlefleet (William Halsey)
  • Complete Multiplayer set for 6 players
    (€74/$84)
    • x1 Complete Expansion set with 6 expansions
    • x4 Wooden Manpower trays
    • x4 Faction bags (2 for each side)
    • x4 Faction dice (2 for each side)
    • x136 Colored and printed wooden tokens
    • x4 Damage cards

  • Complete Datasheets binder (172 pages with technical data and unit analysis)
    (€25/$28)

 

  • Artbook (Illustrations, concepts, sketches)
    (€25/$28)

 

  • Thematic Battlefields (each one supports 2 players)
    (€8/$9 for one Battlefield - €22/$25 for three Battlefields)
  1. Ground Playmat
  2. Aerial Playmat
  3. Naval Playmat

 

HOW TO PURCHASE ADD-ONS

You can add whatever you want to your pledge.

You can add single elements, or if you want the complete experience, the Complete Battlepack perk is what you are looking for.

To purchase one or more add-ons simply follow these 2 seps.

Step 1

Click the pink BACK IT button located at the top of the page. In the text box that pops up enter the amount required for the items you are purchasing, then click the pink CHECK OUT button.

 

Step 2

After the checkout process, go to our website and fill in the required fields with the name, the email and the composition of your order. The items will be confirmed again during the post-campaign BackerKit survey. That's it!

 

 

WHAT WE NEED

Deep War requires a lot of graphic work. Although at a good point (2 of 6 factions already completed), there is still a long way to go and there are still many illustrations to be produced, descriptions to be written, skills to be created and tested and everything must be carefully translated.

We are rising funds to keep working on this project, creating something really special and unique. We have chosen the Flexible Funding because the production base and the first game block are ready, but we need to further develop the game.

If you like the project, help us to spread the word. Like us on Facebook, Instagram or BoardGameGeek or simply share the project on your socials. Your help is invaluable, thank you!

 

 

EXPLORE DEEP WAR

There are 4 main different types of cards. Commanders, Units, Heroes and HQ Supports.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Risks and challenges

Fortunately the risks involved in completing and fulfilling this project are low since the first block of the game (Wehrmacht and US Armed Forces) are completely finished.

The cards (standard poker size 63x88 mm) will be printed by Cartamundi using a special 320 gsm cardboard.
The wooden items will be made by a carpenter who will produce every single piece by hand.

Our biggest challenge now is to channel resources and time into the realization of the next factions and expansions. Future plans are ambitious and it will be thanks to you that we will succeed, all together.

 

My Assurance to you

I would like to assure you that I am confident that if I meet my target, I will be able to honor my commitment to produce, deliver and keep working on Deep War.
I’ve spent a lot of time planning the production and choosing manufacturing partners to achieve the maximum possible quality.

I understand how much trust is requested, but I wish you know that I will do my best to fulfill my promise.
Thank you for your faith and thank you for your support.

story_txt:
Note: The content below is from our Kickstarter Campaign        (We canceled that campaign to move it to Indiegogo)                                                                                   
 https://anchor.fm/betta-games-hq/episodes/Featured-Game-Creator-Liz-Marr-of-Attack-From-Marrs-Games-e3ku76/a-acn3lv                                                Meet the Attack from Marrs Games Team!

story:
In this cooperative math card game for kids, your Elevator is full of Monsters trying to go to work. If the Elevator gets too heavy, it breaks and everyone loses. If the Elevator reaches the 20th floor without breaking, everyone wins! 

Monsters in the Elevator is for 2-6 player, ages 7-to-11 (and up). It takes 2 minutes to learn and 5-20 minutes to play.

There are two decks: The Draw and the Floors. The Draw deck contains Monsters with weight numbers on their bodies.

Each Floor of the Elevator is a new round of the game, where players check the new Floor card and the Monster cards in the Elevator to see if any of those Monsters exit (get discarded).

Then the players each enter a Monster card from their hand into the Elevator at the same time...

 

 

 

 

 

and finally they add up the weights of the Monsters in the Elevator. If the sum is above the Elevator Capacity (50 x the number of players), the Elevator crashes and everyone loses.

 

 

 

 

Otherwise, everyone is dealt a new card and play continues to the next Floor. All the players win if the Elevator makes it safely to the 20th floor!

 

 

 

 

There are also Actions in the Draw deck that you can choose to play instead of a Monster, including cards that Change the Floor up or down, cards that make one Monster Exit to Get Exercise or take a Phone Call, or cards that completely clear the Elevator with Giant Bees or a Fire Alarm. Families can decide how much they want to keep their hand secret and how much they want to share for easier cooperation.

Finally, in the Advanced Mode the Floors are shuffled and played face-down, and without knowing what Floor might show up next, the likelihood of crashing goes up and the game gets much more intense with every round.

WHAT IS IN THE BOX? 

The standard deck contains 96 cards: 20 Floors, 64 Monsters, and 12 Actions (4 All Monster Exits, 4 Single Monster Exits, 3 Change the Floor, and 1 Swap a Monster).  A new card is being added for this Indiegogo with every 100 new contributors-- check out the updates!

My name is Jason Wiser. I teach Art, Animation, and Game Design at Harvard, Tufts, Emerson, and Northeastern Universities. I used to work in console games, but now I make games for my daughter, Yaela, and she loves to share them with others! 

When she started to enjoy math, I designed Monsters in the Elevator with Yaela to help her build math confidence and to learn and practice important skills like estimation and arithmetic. Yaela has been playtesting my games for years, and she was very excited to be involved in this project. She named many of the monsters, decided which art should go with which weight, and created the Advanced Play mode by suggesting we mix up the Floors to remove the carefully crafted pacing, and place the Floors face-down to remove the ability to plan for the next Floor, creating far more intense gameplay experiences!

We have playtested the game for many months and found kids love the cute Monsters and the excitement of trying to survive each round.  Parents love watching their kids get into the calculations to see if the weight is too much on each Floor, and to measure the impact of their choices throughout the game.

We have a fantastic support team of three senior students from The New England Institute of Art: Madeleine Bracket, Jeannie Holmes, and Anna Giannuzzi, who are helping us run demos, design marketing materials, and generally saving the day behind the scenes.

  

It has been so exciting watching kids get thoroughly engrossed in the math of this game. We want to get Monsters in the Elevator into as many homes, schools, and libraries as we can.

We are trying to hit a funding goal of at least $2,500 to meet minimum quantities for quality manufacturing and the production of new cards.​ For every 100 people who donate at any level, we will add a new card to everyone’s deck! For every 50 copies of the game claimed through this campaign we will donate a copy to a library or a school. Help us bring this game to more kids!

We are so excited to be 1 of 5 Finalists in the Hasbro Gaming Lab family game challenge! We need at least 100 different backers to qualify to win, and then the judges will decide (including Shark Tank Judge Daymond John!) . 

  • The main Perk is the game, but given the enthusiasm we have seen for the character designs I am offering stickers and stuffed monsters as well. I love teaching game art and design to students of all ages, so you can expect some Perks about opportunities for art and game development lessons with me.
  • Those who contribute will have access to contests during the campaign!
  • Even if we do not meet our goal, anyone who contributes will get their Perks.

Read the first reviews,

  •  Indie Game Report:

"Monsters in the Elevator is a fantastic little cooperative card game with a real kid-friendly sense of humor. This game packs some nice strategic and educational concepts into a quick, cute and light package. Since you can teach the rules in a matter of a few seconds, I’d highly recommend this game to a family of young gamers."

  •  GeekDad:

"...it’s a cute, quick game that kids will enjoy. There’s a lot of room for some fun variations on the rules to make it more or less challenging, and I could see it being a nice tool in classrooms or anywhere you want to give kids a little practice with addition."

  • Cardboard Republic: 

"With easy to teach rules, an amusingly offbeat premise, and just the right mix of light decision-making alongside an inherent unpredictability over what the other players will do, this is one 20 minute Filler Game that pushes a lot of the right buttons. "

  • We have been thrilled to hear from parents and librarians who got early copies of the game, how much their kids are enjoying it and learning! One librarian said her after-school group was improving their literacy as well as their math: "They learned a new word today, thanks to the Flatulence card. That was pretty awesome. :)" 

"The game is fun and educational!"

"I love that we can interact with people while we are playing!"

(after seeing their child contribute to a team discussion on the math for proceeding to the next floor) "I want this for my kid right now!"

The beauty of a "Flexible" campaign on Indiegogo is we can guarantee everyone who contributes will get their promised Perk. The game will go to press within a month of the end of the campaign. The printer is ready. We just need your help to make it happen!

We want to share Monsters in the Elevator with as many kids as we can. Please help us get the word out about this campaign by using the Indiegogo share tools!

  • Support us on this Indiegogo! 
  • Get an extra copy for another 7-11 year old in your life!
  • Follow us on facebook, twitter, or sign up for email updates!
  • Share this campaign with friends you think might like it using the "Share This Project" buttons!
  • Please email us with any questions or concerns!

PLEASE NOTE: To get a copy/copies of the game please click on a "Perk" option.  The cost of shipping will be added before you donate, as needed.

CANADIANS: I calculated the wrong shipping for you on the regular Perks, and so I set up this Perk just for you!

 

Finally, a plug: Please also check out the Indiegogo campaigns by the other 4 Hasbro Gaming Lab Finalists:

Steve Ehrensperger: Aardvark's Runaway Railroad

Michael Eskue: Trash Pandas

Eugene Bryant: Cloud Control

Kelly North Adams: Chibi Quest
story_txt:
In this cooperative math card game for kids, your Elevator is full of Monsters trying to go to work. If the Elevator gets too heavy, it breaks and everyone loses. If the Elevator reaches the 20th floor without breaking, everyone wins! Monsters in the Elevator is for 2-6 player, ages 7-to-11 (and up). It takes 2 minutes to learn and 5-20 minutes to play.There are two decks: The Draw and the Floors. The Draw deck contains Monsters with weight numbers on their bodies.Each Floor of the Elevator is a new round of the game, where players check the new Floor card and the Monster cards in the Elevator to see if any of those Monsters exit (get discarded).Then the players each enter a Monster card from their hand into the Elevator at the same time...     and finally they add up the weights of the Monsters in the Elevator. If the sum is above the Elevator Capacity (50 x the number of players), the Elevator crashes and everyone loses.    Otherwise, everyone is dealt a new card and play continues to the next Floor. All the players win if the Elevator makes it safely to the 20th floor!    There are also Actions in the Draw deck that you can choose to play instead of a Monster, including cards that Change the Floor up or down, cards that make one Monster Exit to Get Exercise or take a Phone Call, or cards that completely clear the Elevator with Giant Bees or a Fire Alarm. Families can decide how much they want to keep their hand secret and how much they want to share for easier cooperation.Finally, in the Advanced Mode the Floors are shuffled and played face-down, and without knowing what Floor might show up next, the likelihood of crashing goes up and the game gets much more intense with every round.WHAT IS IN THE BOX? The standard deck contains 96 cards: 20 Floors, 64 Monsters, and 12 Actions (4 All Monster Exits, 4 Single Monster Exits, 3 Change the Floor, and 1 Swap a Monster).  A new card is being added for this Indiegogo with every 100 new contributors-- check out the updates!My name is Jason Wiser. I teach Art, Animation, and Game Design at Harvard, Tufts, Emerson, and Northeastern Universities. I used to work in console games, but now I make games for my daughter, Yaela, and she loves to share them with others! When she started to enjoy math, I designed Monsters in the Elevator with Yaela to help her build math confidence and to learn and practice important skills like estimation and arithmetic. Yaela has been playtesting my games for years, and she was very excited to be involved in this project. She named many of the monsters, decided which art should go with which weight, and created the Advanced Play mode by suggesting we mix up the Floors to remove the carefully crafted pacing, and place the Floors face-down to remove the ability to plan for the next Floor, creating far more intense gameplay experiences!We have playtested the game for many months and found kids love the cute Monsters and the excitement of trying to survive each round.  Parents love watching their kids get into the calculations to see if the weight is too much on each Floor, and to measure the impact of their choices throughout the game.We have a fantastic support team of three senior students from The New England Institute of Art: Madeleine Bracket, Jeannie Holmes, and Anna Giannuzzi, who are helping us run demos, design marketing materials, and generally saving the day behind the scenes.  It has been so exciting watching kids get thoroughly engrossed in the math of this game. We want to get Monsters in the Elevator into as many homes, schools, and libraries as we can.We are trying to hit a funding goal of at least $2,500 to meet minimum quantities for quality manufacturing and the production of new cards.​ For every 100 people who donate at any level, we will add a new card to everyone’s deck! For every 50 copies of the game claimed through this campaign we will donate a copy to a library or a school. Help us bring this game to more kids!We are so excited to be 1 of 5 Finalists in the Hasbro Gaming Lab family game challenge! We need at least 100 different backers to qualify to win, and then the judges will decide (including Shark Tank Judge Daymond John!) . 
The main Perk is the game, but given the enthusiasm we have seen for the character designs I am offering stickers and stuffed monsters as well. I love teaching game art and design to students of all ages, so you can expect some Perks about opportunities for art and game development lessons with me.
Those who contribute will have access to contests during the campaign!
Even if we do not meet our goal, anyone who contributes will get their Perks.
Read the first reviews, Indie Game Report:
"Monsters in the Elevator is a fantastic little cooperative card game with a real kid-friendly sense of humor. This game packs some nice strategic and educational concepts into a quick, cute and light package. Since you can teach the rules in a matter of a few seconds, I’d highly recommend this game to a family of young gamers." GeekDad:
"...it’s a cute, quick game that kids will enjoy. There’s a lot of room for some fun variations on the rules to make it more or less challenging, and I could see it being a nice tool in classrooms or anywhere you want to give kids a little practice with addition."Cardboard Republic: "With easy to teach rules, an amusingly offbeat premise, and just the right mix of light decision-making alongside an inherent unpredictability over what the other players will do, this is one 20 minute Filler Game that pushes a lot of the right buttons. "We have been thrilled to hear from parents and librarians who got early copies of the game, how much their kids are enjoying it and learning! One librarian said her after-school group was improving their literacy as well as their math: "They learned a new word today, thanks to the Flatulence card. That was pretty awesome. :)" "The game is fun and educational!""I love that we can interact with people while we are playing!"(after seeing their child contribute to a team discussion on the math for proceeding to the next floor) "I want this for my kid right now!"The beauty of a "Flexible" campaign on Indiegogo is we can guarantee everyone who contributes will get their promised Perk. The game will go to press within a month of the end of the campaign. The printer is ready. We just need your help to make it happen!We want to share Monsters in the Elevator with as many kids as we can. Please help us get the word out about this campaign by using the Indiegogo share tools!

Support us on this Indiegogo! 
Get an extra copy for another 7-11 year old in your life!
Follow us on facebook, twitter, or sign up for email updates!
Share this campaign with friends you think might like it using the "Share This Project" buttons!
Please email us with any questions or concerns!
PLEASE NOTE: To get a copy/copies of the game please click on a "Perk" option.  The cost of shipping will be added before you donate, as needed.CANADIANS: I calculated the wrong shipping for you on the regular Perks, and so I set up this Perk just for you! Finally, a plug: Please also check out the Indiegogo campaigns by the other 4 Hasbro Gaming Lab Finalists:Steve Ehrensperger: Aardvark's Runaway RailroadMichael Eskue: Trash PandasEugene Bryant: Cloud ControlKelly North Adams: Chibi Quest

story:
This project was fully funded with over 260 backers but we wanted to open it up to anyone who may have missed the campaign. Grab your copy while supplies last!!! 

"This is a game with a lot going on and a lot of interesting choice. The theme really comes through" - Mark Streed, The Dice Tower
 
"What appears as a light game about bees actually turns into a deeply strategic experience as you realize how much you'll be competing for precious nectar and trying to outwit your opponents" -Ryan Schoon, Man Vs Meeple
"Apidaia has a refreshing, unique theme and the mechanisms in the game match the theme from pollinating to gathering nectar, and maturing larvae into new bees!" - Dan King, Game Boy Geek

 Read the rules at this link

Take on the role of a Queen Bee. Go out into the world and establish your hive. Lay and mature larva into worker bees. Send those bees out into the world to locate and harvest rich pollen and nourishing nectar. Build your hive and upgrade your abilities. Augment your strategy on the fly based on your unique species abilities and upgrades. Push your luck exploring the world with various perils, predators, and increasing seasonal scarcity as you manage your hive from its inception in the Spring on into Summer and Fall. 

Place the Seasonal Chart, Waggle Dance Track, Common Field, Seasonal Challenge Cards, and Bee Quest Cards. Fill the field with face-down flower hexes and face-up upgrade hexes based on the number of players. 

The Season chart helps track rounds and the increasing scarcity of resources as you play through the inception of your hive in the spring through summer and fall. 

The Waggle Dance Track allows players to send their bees off to identify plentiful resources and create a resource pool that only they can tap into.

The common field presents the communal resource pools that all players can tap into to receive pollen and nectar as well as to construct and upgrade their hive.

Seasonal challenge cards (optional expansion) present the potential consequences of going out to explore the field in search of pollen and nectar. The encounters can be dire.

Bee quests (optional expansion) allow players to send their bees off to accomplish special missions for end-game victory points at the expense of losing that worker permanently

 

Randomly deal out species cards and hive mats or bid for them with starting pollen.

 

 

Optional add-on: Hi-resolution digital copies of the beautiful art in the game including but definitely not limited to:

story:
Hello guys,

I'm Melvin and i'm a person who appreciates the finer things in life,Whenever i think of luxury,the first thing that comes to my mind is Carbon Fiber/Titanium(Richard Mille watches fans or Pagani(Carbotanium) instead of the precious stones or precious metal,I want to give you something that is durable with a touch of taste in fashion in it.

What We Need & What You Get

 


 Everyone knows that titanium is a expensive material and it is extremely durable.In order for me to keep creating innovative and attention to detail products,a mold is needed and therefore there is a minimum fixed cost,especially when you want to make it different.

'Carnage Titan Dice' is no ordinary dice which consist of just six square with sharp edges,all the edges are buffed down to create another layer to give the numerical square a more enhanced look.

You can choose yours in clear gloss black/silver or even in brushed finishing.

To buff out the Titanium into making it clear gloss surface takes a lot of man hour to do so,

The Impact

As a person who is very anal about attention to detail and finishing,i would like the world to share my passion and creation appreciated by other people and being used,be it on the gaming table/mahjong or even just for display purposes

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • I have already created the mold for this and am looking forward to coming out with different symbolic numerals in the near future (e.g Roman Numerals/Ancient etc)

story:
Hello!

We are a young team of 2 Graphic designers who loves board games and memes. So why not combine them? We created this game to have fun with friends and beat them with our best memes. You have a better meme under sleeve?

What we need?

We started this crowdfunding campaign because we need funds to craft the game and improve it. This is still a concept but the final version will be shown in an unboxing and gameplay video if we will reach the goal of 1.000 $.

Memes board game

Memes is a game where you must beat your opponents by posting your best meme cards, receive many upvotes and reach Trending and Hot section becoming the Memes King.
 At the beginning of the game every player will receive 1 pawn, 1 Upvote token, 1 Downvote token and 7 Special tokens. Special tokens are placed with face down random on the board by the players. Reaching with your pawn a square where you placed a token will be unlocked that token and you can use it against others players. Memes It can be played in 3-5 players.

Tokens

  •  Upvote - upvote a post and that player will receive +1 square space with his pawn.
  •  Downvote - downvote a post and that player will receive -1 square space with his pawn.

Special Tokens

  •  Share - share a post and steal all upvotes and downvotes from that player who posted.
  •  Block - block a post and all upvotes and downvotes will be canceled.
  •  Draw - draw 1 card from each player and post them.
  •  Repost - Swap your post with other players post and receive all upvotes and downvotes from that post.

Shuffle all cards and deal to each player 5 cards. Now is all set and the game can begin!
Let the best meme win!

The Box

  • 1 Board
  • 200 Meme Cards
  • 45 Tokens
  • 5 Pawns
  • Rulebook

Perks

  • Memes Standard = 35$
  • Memes Plus = 55$
  • Memes Custom = 100$
  • Memes Plus & Comics Deck = 80$
  • Memes Gold = 150$

Goals

  •  At 1.000 $ We will do an unboxing and gameplay video.
  •  At 3.000 $ We will show New Deck of cards, Special Deck of cards and Custom Deck of cards.
  •  At 5.000 $ We will release our official website where you can order the board game and all who claimed perks will receive a special code.
  • At campaign ended ( 6.000 $ or lower) we will begin packaging and delivery to you.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share with your friends if you like the idea.
  • Word of mouth be grate as well.
  • Stay tuned with the campaign.

story:
Do you have a passion for words?  Do you have a knack for telling stories and writing poetry? Are you into 2alsh (puns)? If so, then 7areef El 7uruf is the game for you!

We’re Makouk, a small out-of-this-world company, passionate about creating games and products that have the power to ignite your curiosity, make you laugh, question and learn. You can learn more about us by visiting www.makouk.com.

We're crowdfunding to reproduce 7areef el 7uruf! 7areef is a 4-in-1 language-based game in Arabic, for up to 10 players. It comes in a small, mobile package that you can travel with wherever you go. It’s suitable for ages 10+ and works if you play it in both classical and colloquial Arabic. The game was crafted by Makouk, in collaboration with the brilliant Sherine Abdel Rasul.

 

We're trying to raise $7,000 to produce 1,500 copies of the game. If we reach $10,700 we'll be able to produce 2,500 copies!

 

You can play the game in four different ways: there's 7areef El 7uruf, a word-play game, 7areef El 7agat, a fun and challenging category game, 7areef El She3r, a poetry game, and last but not least, 7areef El Kesas, a game that allows you to make-up stories.

 

Simply put, 7areef is a fun, highly interactive game that allows us to delve into the beauty of the Arabic language. It gives friends and families the chance to put their smart-phones away and explore the humorous, poetic and creative parts of themselves.

It helps create some of the most important experiences we can think of: play, self-expression, laughter and connection.

Simply because we believe in the power of co-creation!

Through crowdfunding, we all get a chance to co-create and give birth to things we would love to have in our lives.

We believe in our equal ability to make the things we value come to life. You have the power to bring about a re-birth of this product. We'll do our part by carrying out the creative and design aspects of the project.

As a young company trying to flourish in the industry of education and play in Egypt, we face a lot of challenges (as you can imagine), which we navigate with happiness and curiosity. But one thing we know for sure is that we’re not alone, and we don’t have to carry the entire weight on our own.

We have you!

That’s simply why we love to crowdfund!

Here's our awesome list of perks you can get during this campaign

7areef El Keneif: a funky wordsearch poster for bathroom lovers!

The Tote bag: A bag that also doubles as an on the go 7areef El 7uruf game!

 

 

7areef T-shirt: Who needs to kill time, the 7areef t-shirt is a game in itself, just find a stranger to play with!

 

Personalized 7areef game: The limited special edition 7areef El 7uruf game where your face or a friend's illustrated on the game's tokens! Why? Because YOU think you're a "7areef". Great perk for friends, or narcissists.

 

Yes! Beladna Board game (V2.0) was our first crowdfunding campaign on Indiegogo, we successfully raised 8,000$, reaching our goal, and gained over 100+ backers!

 

How can YOU support?

Pre-order your game! You'll be getting your game along with the perks you choose, and we'll be one step closer to our goal.

Spread the word! Share this campaign with people who might be interested in this game or cause!
