story:
Welcome to Wunderkammer: The Card Game of Curating Curious Collections! 

In Wunderkammer you are a Collector on the hunt for strange and exotic items to populate your Cabinet of Curiosities.

You will compete in several rounds of auctions, trying to procure rare and unusual pieces like marvellous mechanisms, bizarre artefacts and eerie medical oddities.

The auction system featured in this game is quite unique: players can never be certain as to what items their opponents are trying to win, so they must use their wits to deduce their competitors' intentions. Players increase the value of their Cabinet by 'curating': arranging items so that one is thematically linked to another, creating an aesthetic cohesion to the collection. At the end of the last round, the player whose Cabinet is worth the most wins! 

3-5 players , 15 to 25 minutes to play.

'Wunderkammer' is a German word that translates as "chamber of wonders". The closest English term would be 'Cabinet of Curiosities'. A Wunderkammer is a space, typically a cabinet, where collections of strange, rare, exotic and ingeniously crafted objects are organised and exhibited.  

This style of collecting has a very long history, going back hundreds of years to the time of the Renaissance. Before public museums became commonplace, collections of an artistic, scientific or historical nature were usually privately owned and curated by aristocrats, academics and artists.

During this period, the rapid developments in science, art and travel had cultivated a taste for the unusual and novel among the more genteel classes of society. Possessing rare, exotic and bizarre objects became very fashionable, and collectors would often commission elaborately decorated cabinets to display their unique collections. 

Most Wunderkammer during this time were a blend of anything and everything the owner found of interest; one might find jewellery, sea shells, astrolabes, oil paintings, religious relics, taxidermy, exotic pharmaceuticals and the kitchen sink all displayed on the same shelf. However, regardless of what was in a collection, as long as it piqued the curiosity of the viewer, then it qualified as a proper Wunderkammer! 

The goal of the game is to curate the most valuable Cabinet of Curiosities among one's peers. During a round each player will acquire an Item Card during an Auction Phase, which may increase the point value of their Cabinet when added to their collection. After seven rounds are finished, the player with the most points wins. 

Setup of the game is relatively quick and straightforward. First, each player is dealt an equal number of Money Cards, of which there are four denominations. Then a deck of Item Cards is placed in the middle of the table, within everyone's reach. Points Tokens, Priority Tokens and the Dealer Token are placed near the Item Deck as well. 

The game is divided into seven Rounds in which every player, regardless of their performance, will acquire an Item Card for their Cabinet. Each Round consists of 4 Phases: 

At the start of the Evaluation Phase, the Dealer for the Round will turn over a number of Item Cards equal to the number of players in the game (for example, in a three player game, three Item Cards are turned over). This spread of Item Cards is called 'The Market'. Players will privately assess the value of each card in the Market relative to the Item Cards in their own Cabinet (and those of their opponents). 

Item Cards feature an Item Title (a fancy Latin name), an Item Image and one or more symbols near the bottom, called Categories. As will be explained later, players will try to acquire cards with Categories that match those of cards in their Cabinet. 

The Bidding Phase of Wunderkammer features a unique auction mechanic that offers considerable depth and challenge for players.

Unlike conventional auctions, players do not declare a bid on a specific Item Card, rather they bid to win the highest Priority. Priority is the order in which players choose cards from the Market in the following Curation Phase.

This means that players can never be certain as to what Items Cards their opponents are trying to obtain. However, by examining other players' Cabinets during the Evaluation Phase, they can try to deduce their opponent's plans.

The Auction starts with the Dealer of that round and turns follow clockwise, giving each player the opportunity to bid or pass.

Bidding: For the first bid of the auction, the amount can be any value above zero. The bidding player will place an amount of Money Cards face up in front of them and announce the value. It will then be the next player's turn to bid or pass. If the next player chooses to bid, they must place in front of them an amount of Money Cards greater than the bid made immediately before them.

Passing: A player may instead choose to pass during their turn in the Auction Phase. If a player passes, they may not bid again for that round and any Money Cards from their previous bids remain on the table. 

Passing is actually what determines Priority, or the order in which players may choose Item Cards. The first player to pass in the Auction Phase will be the last player to choose an Item Card during the Curation Phase. The second player to pass will be the second last to choose a card, and so forth. After declaring a pass, the player will take a numbered Priority Token to keep track of their Priority order.

The Auction Phase ends when all players but one have passed (the last person standing, so to speak). All money cards spent on bids are then removed from play; none of them are returned to the players after an auction. So when a player decides to make a bid, they better mean it!

During the Curation Phase, each player will take a turn choosing an Item Card from the Market in order of highest Priority determined during the Auction Phase. So, the player that won the auction (didn't pass) will be first to choose a card, the last player to pass will be second to choose, and so on. (This is where the Priority Tokens  come in handy as they keep track of Priority order)

When all of the players have chosen an Item Card, they will add it to their Cabinet by placing it on either the leftmost or rightmost end of the series (in the case of the first round, they will simply place the card in front of them). Item Cards are never placed above, below or on top of other cards in the Cabinet (except for one special case, described later). Once placed in the Cabinet, cards may not be moved or rearranged in any way. 

In order to earn points, a newly placed Item Card must share one or more Category icons with its adjacent neighbour(s). For every shared Category between adjoining cards, one point is earned. 

There are three Categories in this game, which are based on actual classifications used by collectors long ago. They are: 

  • Naturalia: this category represents objects found in nature: minerals, plants, taxidermy, fossils, etc.  
  • Artificialia: this category represents objects of an artificial and artistic nature: sculpture, paintings, ceramics, jewellery, etc.  
  • Scientifica: this category represents objects that are related to the scientific fields: telescopes, astrolabes, medical apparatus, time pieces, etc.

In the early days of Wunderkammer, taxonomy wasn't strict by any means, and objects would often overlap multiple categories. This reality is reflected in the game by Item Cards that feature multiple icons. For example, an ostrich egg mounted within a silver setting would be categorised as both Artificialia and Naturalia. Or an automaton (mechanical toy), while being a marvel of engineering, is also a work of art, and would be considered as both Artificialia and Scientifica. 

There are also special Item Cards in the deck that are empty; they don't feature an item and have no Categories. When added to a Cabinet, they do not earn the player any points. However, players are permitted to place a newly acquired Item Card on top of an empty card in the Cabinet. Acquiring empty cards isn't necessarily a bad thing, and if played wisely they can actually be an asset later in the game. 

After all of the players have added their new Item Cards to their Cabinet we come to the Appraisal Phase. Players will count the number of categories shared between the newly added Item Card and its adjacent neighbour(s). For every shared Category, a point is earned; the player will then take an appropriate number of Point Tokens and place them between the two cards to track score.

After the Appraisal Phase has ended a new round begins (unless it was the seventh round, in which case the game ends). The player that won the highest Priority in the last round becomes the Dealer for the new round (and receives the Dealer Token). Priority Tokens are returned to their original place on the table. 

For the seventh round, things operate a little differently. Rather than holding an auction to establish who has Priority, order is determined by who has the most money (since bidding would be rather redundant). In the case where two or more players have equal amounts of money, Priority is resolved by who is first in turn order, clockwise from the dealer.

After the seventh round the game has ended, and players add up all of the Point Tokens in their Cabinet. The player with the most points wins, as their Wunderkammer is, indeed, the most magnificent. In the case of a tie, a rematch is probably in order! 

Many people who followed development of the game or helped playtest were curious about what inspired me to start this project and the kind of research I did. 

Visiting museums, private collections and auctions provided a ton of ideas for things I wanted to include in the game.

And being a collector as well, some items are actually based on articles in my own Wunderkammer collection.

Here are a few photos I took showing example of items from my collection:

With the project already fully funded, I have spent the past month working with both my manufacturer and fulfilment service planning production and logistics. 

The game is almost ready to hit the presses as the cards, tokens, etc. are designed. The  components are quite straightforward from a manufacturing point of view, and quality control from prepress to packaging will be carefully monitored.

As I did with the crowdfunding campaign itself, I will be giving regular updates and responding to questions and comments as quickly as I can.

In terms of potential challenges, shipping delays are one of the trickier risks to mitigate. However, both the manufacturer and the fulfilment service I have chosen have a solid track record of successfully delivering products of this kind.
story_txt:
Welcome to Wunderkammer: The Card Game of Curating Curious Collections! In Wunderkammer you are a Collector on the hunt for strange and exotic items to populate your Cabinet of Curiosities.You will compete in several rounds of auctions, trying to procure rare and unusual pieces like marvellous mechanisms, bizarre artefacts and eerie medical oddities.The auction system featured in this game is quite unique: players can never be certain as to what items their opponents are trying to win, so they must use their wits to deduce their competitors' intentions. Players increase the value of their Cabinet by 'curating': arranging items so that one is thematically linked to another, creating an aesthetic cohesion to the collection. At the end of the last round, the player whose Cabinet is worth the most wins! 3-5 players , 15 to 25 minutes to play.'Wunderkammer' is a German word that translates as "chamber of wonders". The closest English term would be 'Cabinet of Curiosities'. A Wunderkammer is a space, typically a cabinet, where collections of strange, rare, exotic and ingeniously crafted objects are organised and exhibited.  This style of collecting has a very long history, going back hundreds of years to the time of the Renaissance. Before public museums became commonplace, collections of an artistic, scientific or historical nature were usually privately owned and curated by aristocrats, academics and artists.During this period, the rapid developments in science, art and travel had cultivated a taste for the unusual and novel among the more genteel classes of society. Possessing rare, exotic and bizarre objects became very fashionable, and collectors would often commission elaborately decorated cabinets to display their unique collections. Most Wunderkammer during this time were a blend of anything and everything the owner found of interest; one might find jewellery, sea shells, astrolabes, oil paintings, religious relics, taxidermy, exotic pharmaceuticals and the kitchen sink all displayed on the same shelf. However, regardless of what was in a collection, as long as it piqued the curiosity of the viewer, then it qualified as a proper Wunderkammer! The goal of the game is to curate the most valuable Cabinet of Curiosities among one's peers. During a round each player will acquire an Item Card during an Auction Phase, which may increase the point value of their Cabinet when added to their collection. After seven rounds are finished, the player with the most points wins. Setup of the game is relatively quick and straightforward. First, each player is dealt an equal number of Money Cards, of which there are four denominations. Then a deck of Item Cards is placed in the middle of the table, within everyone's reach. Points Tokens, Priority Tokens and the Dealer Token are placed near the Item Deck as well. The game is divided into seven Rounds in which every player, regardless of their performance, will acquire an Item Card for their Cabinet. Each Round consists of 4 Phases: At the start of the Evaluation Phase, the Dealer for the Round will turn over a number of Item Cards equal to the number of players in the game (for example, in a three player game, three Item Cards are turned over). This spread of Item Cards is called 'The Market'. Players will privately assess the value of each card in the Market relative to the Item Cards in their own Cabinet (and those of their opponents). Item Cards feature an Item Title (a fancy Latin name), an Item Image and one or more symbols near the bottom, called Categories. As will be explained later, players will try to acquire cards with Categories that match those of cards in their Cabinet. The Bidding Phase of Wunderkammer features a unique auction mechanic that offers considerable depth and challenge for players.Unlike conventional auctions, players do not declare a bid on a specific Item Card, rather they bid to win the highest Priority. Priority is the order in which players choose cards from the Market in the following Curation Phase.This means that players can never be certain as to what Items Cards their opponents are trying to obtain. However, by examining other players' Cabinets during the Evaluation Phase, they can try to deduce their opponent's plans.The Auction starts with the Dealer of that round and turns follow clockwise, giving each player the opportunity to bid or pass.Bidding: For the first bid of the auction, the amount can be any value above zero. The bidding player will place an amount of Money Cards face up in front of them and announce the value. It will then be the next player's turn to bid or pass. If the next player chooses to bid, they must place in front of them an amount of Money Cards greater than the bid made immediately before them.Passing: A player may instead choose to pass during their turn in the Auction Phase. If a player passes, they may not bid again for that round and any Money Cards from their previous bids remain on the table. Passing is actually what determines Priority, or the order in which players may choose Item Cards. The first player to pass in the Auction Phase will be the last player to choose an Item Card during the Curation Phase. The second player to pass will be the second last to choose a card, and so forth. After declaring a pass, the player will take a numbered Priority Token to keep track of their Priority order.The Auction Phase ends when all players but one have passed (the last person standing, so to speak). All money cards spent on bids are then removed from play; none of them are returned to the players after an auction. So when a player decides to make a bid, they better mean it!During the Curation Phase, each player will take a turn choosing an Item Card from the Market in order of highest Priority determined during the Auction Phase. So, the player that won the auction (didn't pass) will be first to choose a card, the last player to pass will be second to choose, and so on. (This is where the Priority Tokens  come in handy as they keep track of Priority order)When all of the players have chosen an Item Card, they will add it to their Cabinet by placing it on either the leftmost or rightmost end of the series (in the case of the first round, they will simply place the card in front of them). Item Cards are never placed above, below or on top of other cards in the Cabinet (except for one special case, described later). Once placed in the Cabinet, cards may not be moved or rearranged in any way. In order to earn points, a newly placed Item Card must share one or more Category icons with its adjacent neighbour(s). For every shared Category between adjoining cards, one point is earned. There are three Categories in this game, which are based on actual classifications used by collectors long ago. They are: 

Naturalia: this category represents objects found in nature: minerals, plants, taxidermy, fossils, etc.  

Artificialia: this category represents objects of an artificial and artistic nature: sculpture, paintings, ceramics, jewellery, etc.  

Scientifica: this category represents objects that are related to the scientific fields: telescopes, astrolabes, medical apparatus, time pieces, etc.
In the early days of Wunderkammer, taxonomy wasn't strict by any means, and objects would often overlap multiple categories. This reality is reflected in the game by Item Cards that feature multiple icons. For example, an ostrich egg mounted within a silver setting would be categorised as both Artificialia and Naturalia. Or an automaton (mechanical toy), while being a marvel of engineering, is also a work of art, and would be considered as both Artificialia and Scientifica. There are also special Item Cards in the deck that are empty; they don't feature an item and have no Categories. When added to a Cabinet, they do not earn the player any points. However, players are permitted to place a newly acquired Item Card on top of an empty card in the Cabinet. Acquiring empty cards isn't necessarily a bad thing, and if played wisely they can actually be an asset later in the game. After all of the players have added their new Item Cards to their Cabinet we come to the Appraisal Phase. Players will count the number of categories shared between the newly added Item Card and its adjacent neighbour(s). For every shared Category, a point is earned; the player will then take an appropriate number of Point Tokens and place them between the two cards to track score.After the Appraisal Phase has ended a new round begins (unless it was the seventh round, in which case the game ends). The player that won the highest Priority in the last round becomes the Dealer for the new round (and receives the Dealer Token). Priority Tokens are returned to their original place on the table. For the seventh round, things operate a little differently. Rather than holding an auction to establish who has Priority, order is determined by who has the most money (since bidding would be rather redundant). In the case where two or more players have equal amounts of money, Priority is resolved by who is first in turn order, clockwise from the dealer.After the seventh round the game has ended, and players add up all of the Point Tokens in their Cabinet. The player with the most points wins, as their Wunderkammer is, indeed, the most magnificent. In the case of a tie, a rematch is probably in order! Many people who followed development of the game or helped playtest were curious about what inspired me to start this project and the kind of research I did. Visiting museums, private collections and auctions provided a ton of ideas for things I wanted to include in the game.And being a collector as well, some items are actually based on articles in my own Wunderkammer collection.Here are a few photos I took showing example of items from my collection:With the project already fully funded, I have spent the past month working with both my manufacturer and fulfilment service planning production and logistics. The game is almost ready to hit the presses as the cards, tokens, etc. are designed. The  components are quite straightforward from a manufacturing point of view, and quality control from prepress to packaging will be carefully monitored.As I did with the crowdfunding campaign itself, I will be giving regular updates and responding to questions and comments as quickly as I can.In terms of potential challenges, shipping delays are one of the trickier risks to mitigate. However, both the manufacturer and the fulfilment service I have chosen have a solid track record of successfully delivering products of this kind.

story:
Pope or Nope was launched on Kickstarter and successfully funded on July 4, 2019 with $14,259 from 453 backers.

Through this InDemand campaign, you can claim one of our excess copies and receive the game just as soon as our Kickstarter backers do, in October of this year.

From the team who brought you SERPENTS, comes Pope or Nope! 

 

His Holiness Pope Peter II lies on his deathbed. You are among the few Cardinals he trusts to serve as his successor, but you have to earn it by performing good deeds. To complicate things, the other Cardinals won't go down without a fight; they'll do everything they can to sabotage your every move. 

Pay them back in kind. 

 

Each round, each player is dealt 5 cards.

Players are given the opportunity to play a DEED from their hand by placing it face-down in front of them. Once all players have played a DEED (if able), all players flip their cards face-up. Subsequent cards played during the round will be played on top of these initial DEEDS.

Players take turns playing one card at a time, starting with the player holding the INITIATIVE TOKEN, and continuing clockwise.

 

 

A player's turn consists of one of the following:

  • SABOTAGE - play a matching CROSS card on another player's DEED
  • REDEMPTION - play a DEED of the next level on a CROSS card
  • USE OF AN ACTION CARD
  • PASSING - out of necessity, or strategically

 

When all players have passed in succession (or have run out of cards), the round ends.

ALL cards from the round are discarded.

Any DEED that is not CROSSED at the end of the round is worth 1 point to the player.

The first player to earn 5 points wins the game.

Pope Peter II may have ideas about who should succeed him, but His Majesty King Carlos II has his own list of papabili. Work collaboratively to defeat the opposition. 

When playing with an even number of players, Pope or Nope can be played in teams. The first team to earn 7 points is the winner.

 

Watch our 6-minute comprehensive tutorial.

 

 

Numbered I-IV, these cards represent "good deeds" that each cardinal may perform. The higher the level, the greater the deed, and the rarer the card. DEEDS can be played on cards whose level is one less than their own. 

Numbered I-IV, these cards give each cardinal the ability to sabotage the deeds of another. CROSS cards can only be played on DEED cards of the same level. If a DEED remains CROSSED, it will not be worth a point at the end of the round.

This card is used to "reduce" the level of any numbered card in play by 1.

When REDUCO is played on a Level I DEED, the player is thrust into "Dante's Infernope". This DEED is now Level 0 and is not worth a point.

This Player has been thrust into the second circle of "Dante's Infernope"

This card is used to "cancel" a card that is already in play. All cards that may be "cancelled" feature the CANCELLO STAMP.

When placed in front of a player this card offers a new "opportunity" for the performance of a good deed, and the chance to earn multiple points in a single round. 

Discard this card to draw two cards to your hand.

The POPE card acts as a "wild" DEED. However, it cannot be played to begin a round or to fill an OPPORTUNITAS card, and cannot be reduced. It is still vulnerable to sabotage with the correct CROSS.

When the POPE is played on a Level IV card, "Papal Infallibility" is invoked. This DEED can now only be sabotaged by a NOPE. 

When the POPE is played on a DEED below Level I, he lifts the player out of "Dante's Infernope" and acts as a Level I DEED. 

A NOPE card is the ultimate sabotage. NOPE can be played on any card in play and redemption is impossible.


Click here to access the Print and Play Edition

Click here to play online at Tabletopia.com

Click here to view our tentative Rule Sheet

UNO? More like Ew, No.

 

 

 

One copy of Pope or Nope. Includes any Stretch Goals reached.

 

Celebrate victory by donning the Paper Papal Mitre. Fold it up and store it in the game box when finished.

 

 

A digital download of the Pope or Nope Official Soundtrack, featuring 20 minutes of original music, as heard in our promotional videos. 

 

ADDITIONAL COPIES OF POPE OR NOPE 

+ $16 per copy

If you'd like an extra copy of Pope or Nope, just add $16 to your pledge, send us a message letting us know, and we'll send you an extra copy.

 

 

 

 

 

 

THE HUNGRY GAMER

Preview Video

Gameplay Review

"I really enjoy the theme of this game. [...] I also really like the idea behind the mechanics. It is clever, and it is a good balance of playing cards on yourself and on others."

 

JORGE ZHANG

Rulebook Review

"Overall, Pope or Nope seems like an interesting and highly interactive game that is very simple to learn, but still has some strategy to it!"

Gameplay Review

"Our group really loved this game. I personally enjoyed it a lot, and found that Pope or Nope made for a very simple and easy game to bring out to the table. I would recommend the game to those looking for a fast-paced game with a lot of player interaction."

 

ARTHUR MONTGOLFIER 

Instagram Review

"It can get quite competitive (and that is exactly what I am looking for in my party games) we had a decent amount of laughs during the game. I advise you to look into this if your game shelf lacks that 'quick party game for everyone to get into'."

 

INOD

French Language Review

"Avec comme mécanique forte, cette possibilité de plus ou moins se concentrer sur ses actes de bonté ou ceux adverses."

 

Partners

To ensure a quality product, a smooth, speedy fulfillment process, and low shipping rates, we've partnered with some of the best. 

We'll be manufacturing with AdMagic. 

You may be familiar with games they have manufactured before, including: Exploding Kittens, Cards Against Humanity, Secret Hitler, and Joking Hazard. 

 

For fulfillment, we'll be partnering with Flowship. 

Click to learn more about our logistics plan.

 

We will be subsidizing your shipping in this campaign, meaning for every order, we'll be absorbing some of the shipping costs in order to simplify pricing on your end, and save you a little money in the process. 

We will be taking care of any import taxes. The price you see when you finalize your pledge is the price you pay. No surprises.

story:
Nor Cal Mythos is a startup game design company. In Carbyne Jungle, we created a game system designed around everything we love in RPGs.

    • Story: Carbyne Jungle takes place in an expansive universe filled with fantasy and sci-fi elements, a deep backstory, and a rich setting filled with quest seeds to get games going.
    • Options: Our characters are completely customizable. Choose between hundreds of options of backgrounds for millions of possible combinations of abilities. 
    • Fun: We designed our game engine with three styles of gameplay for players of all skill levels, all of which can be played simultaneously. Beginners can join right into the game using a simple ruleset and not miss out on any of the fun as they learn the Stock or Strategic rules.
    • Unique Gameplay: In addition to  traditional roleplaying, we have an autorun game for times when no one wants to GM, and a card system to assist in gameplay and in creating random dungeons.
    • Game Decks: Our game decks make playing simpler, are used for the Flip N Fight ruleset that allows brand new gamers to jump into the RPG, and also for premade games that the entire gaming group can play. Those decks can also then be shuffled in to create random quests for players.

    The Core Rules of Carbyne Jungle are just about ready to go, but there are a few things we still are pushing for:

    • Artwork: In short, there is a lot of gorgeous art created by talented people, and we want to license it for our decks and other products. 
    • Advertising: The simple rule is the more of a product we can produce, the cheaper we can produce them for. Our game decks are perfect example. Bought one at a time, the decks cost $25 each. Bought a thousand at a time, we can cut our costs and the costs of our customers down to a third of that.  
    • Expansions: We look to add premade campaigns, new character types, expanded mythology, and new game decks. 
    • Game Apps: We want to build an app for character creation and/or gameplay, and this is a step towards getting that created. 

    Amazing Gaming Experience

    Honestly, we believe we have built the best RPG gaming experience, and we aren't planning on stopping here. Tabletop RPGs are a great way to come together with people you enjoy spending time with and have a good time. Carbyne Jungle is a great game, and we plan on continuing to release content for CJ and other games as well. 

    A Chance to be part of the game!

    Take a look at the perks for opportunities to put yourself or one of your characters into one of our expansions. Do you have a favorite character? Give us a description and he can be added to one of our first expansions: The Rogue's Gallery. Or at the least, you can get yourself a planet!

    Everyone who Purchases a Rogue's Gallery, Hostile Takeover, World Builder, or Made Man will get a FREE digital copy of the The Rogue's Gallery expansion in September.

    Starting Out:

    You have a variety of species to choose from ranging from those similar to classic fantasy characters to completely new peoples with distinct cultures and tendencies. We have 12 different character archetypes to choose from, with primal archetypes like the Vatcher, Mystic, and Berzerker who use advanced technology shaped around a tribal culture. High tech classes like the Nanician, Droid Master, or Operator use heavily personalized technology to take the fight forward. We also have three Military based archetypes and the Quantum Channelers who used an advanced magic system to alter the laws of physics. See our website norcalmythos.com for more information.

    Character Advancement:

    Advancement is all about your story. Each session your character grows in a path that you choose. We don't use a level system and there are no forced advancement paths that are chosen for you. You get to decide exactly what you want your character to be.

    Advancing doesn't just mean dealing more damage. We have social advancements, group affiliations, and a skill system designed to make conflicts outside of fights just as important as fighting (although there is nothing stopping a party from having a campaign built around random mayhem. Classics never die.)

    We have a 6 tier system that gives an idea of you current power level. Our system is designed to get you to the 6th tier after about 1 year of weekly games, but you have the option to accelerate the rate or slow it down, depending on your parties preference, and the standard rules have characters max out after about 100 sessions.

    Play Options

    The Tri-Forge game engine has 3 Modes of Gameplay built in for beginners through advanced players. The engine though is designed to have 2 (or even 3) versions of the game allowed to be played at the same time. Getting new players into an established game can be hard, especially with a complex  system, but with our game engine, new players can jump in without slowing down the game. As they get the rules down, players can graduate to the harder rulesets, or if they want just keep playing with the standard rules.

    Game Decks

    We designed Game Card Decks for prebuilt campaigns and Auto-Run games. The game cards come with statistics for targets(Think Monsters), rooms, and equipment that can make any game simpler to play. Campaign decks have everything needed to go through a campaign, with or without a GM (although nothing replaces a good Game Master.) These decks also can be mixed and match for random dungeon games. 

    Character Creation

    Please share us on social media, and if you have enjoyed what you have seen, please tell your friends, your family, your game-mates and anyone else you think would be interested in the Carbyne Jungle all about us.

    As a thank you, when you share take a screenshot and email it to us at norcalmythos@gmail.com and we will send you a desktop wallpaper commemorating our first launch.

    Happy Gaming
story_txt:
Nor Cal Mythos is a startup game design company. In Carbyne Jungle, we created a game system designed around everything we love in RPGs.


Story: Carbyne Jungle takes place in an expansive universe filled with fantasy and sci-fi elements, a deep backstory, and a rich setting filled with quest seeds to get games going.

Options: Our characters are completely customizable. Choose between hundreds of options of backgrounds for millions of possible combinations of abilities. 

Fun: We designed our game engine with three styles of gameplay for players of all skill levels, all of which can be played simultaneously. Beginners can join right into the game using a simple ruleset and not miss out on any of the fun as they learn the Stock or Strategic rules.

Unique Gameplay: In addition to  traditional roleplaying, we have an autorun game for times when no one wants to GM, and a card system to assist in gameplay and in creating random dungeons.

Game Decks: Our game decks make playing simpler, are used for the Flip N Fight ruleset that allows brand new gamers to jump into the RPG, and also for premade games that the entire gaming group can play. Those decks can also then be shuffled in to create random quests for players.




The Core Rules of Carbyne Jungle are just about ready to go, but there are a few things we still are pushing for:


Artwork: In short, there is a lot of gorgeous art created by talented people, and we want to license it for our decks and other products. 

Advertising: The simple rule is the more of a product we can produce, the cheaper we can produce them for. Our game decks are perfect example. Bought one at a time, the decks cost $25 each. Bought a thousand at a time, we can cut our costs and the costs of our customers down to a third of that.  

Expansions: We look to add premade campaigns, new character types, expanded mythology, and new game decks. 

Game Apps: We want to build an app for character creation and/or gameplay, and this is a step towards getting that created. 



Amazing Gaming Experience
Honestly, we believe we have built the best RPG gaming experience, and we aren't planning on stopping here. Tabletop RPGs are a great way to come together with people you enjoy spending time with and have a good time. Carbyne Jungle is a great game, and we plan on continuing to release content for CJ and other games as well. 
A Chance to be part of the game!
Take a look at the perks for opportunities to put yourself or one of your characters into one of our expansions. Do you have a favorite character? Give us a description and he can be added to one of our first expansions: The Rogue's Gallery. Or at the least, you can get yourself a planet!
Everyone who Purchases a Rogue's Gallery, Hostile Takeover, World Builder, or Made Man will get a FREE digital copy of the The Rogue's Gallery expansion in September.


Starting Out:

You have a variety of species to choose from ranging from those similar to classic fantasy characters to completely new peoples with distinct cultures and tendencies. We have 12 different character archetypes to choose from, with primal archetypes like the Vatcher, Mystic, and Berzerker who use advanced technology shaped around a tribal culture. High tech classes like the Nanician, Droid Master, or Operator use heavily personalized technology to take the fight forward. We also have three Military based archetypes and the Quantum Channelers who used an advanced magic system to alter the laws of physics. See our website norcalmythos.com for more information.
Character Advancement:
Advancement is all about your story. Each session your character grows in a path that you choose. We don't use a level system and there are no forced advancement paths that are chosen for you. You get to decide exactly what you want your character to be.
Advancing doesn't just mean dealing more damage. We have social advancements, group affiliations, and a skill system designed to make conflicts outside of fights just as important as fighting (although there is nothing stopping a party from having a campaign built around random mayhem. Classics never die.)
We have a 6 tier system that gives an idea of you current power level. Our system is designed to get you to the 6th tier after about 1 year of weekly games, but you have the option to accelerate the rate or slow it down, depending on your parties preference, and the standard rules have characters max out after about 100 sessions.
Play Options
The Tri-Forge game engine has 3 Modes of Gameplay built in for beginners through advanced players. The engine though is designed to have 2 (or even 3) versions of the game allowed to be played at the same time. Getting new players into an established game can be hard, especially with a complex  system, but with our game engine, new players can jump in without slowing down the game. As they get the rules down, players can graduate to the harder rulesets, or if they want just keep playing with the standard rules.
Game Decks
We designed Game Card Decks for prebuilt campaigns and Auto-Run games. The game cards come with statistics for targets(Think Monsters), rooms, and equipment that can make any game simpler to play. Campaign decks have everything needed to go through a campaign, with or without a GM (although nothing replaces a good Game Master.) These decks also can be mixed and match for random dungeon games. 
Character Creation


Please share us on social media, and if you have enjoyed what you have seen, please tell your friends, your family, your game-mates and anyone else you think would be interested in the Carbyne Jungle all about us.

As a thank you, when you share take a screenshot and email it to us at norcalmythos@gmail.com and we will send you a desktop wallpaper commemorating our first launch.
Happy Gaming

story:
Our Story:

Six years ago, we used an Indiegogo project to launch our children's holiday story, The Legend of Ranger, the Reindeer who Couldn't Fly. Not only was the project successful, but the book has gone on to receive awards (Mom's Choice, and MCP Grand Prize winner), and critics have been unanimous in their praise. It has even been called "the best new holiday story since Rudolf!"  We went on to create a CD with Ranger's song, "Dream and Believe," and the full audio book, as well as an adorable 6" soft toy "Ranger" to the delight of younger children.

Parents (and grandparents!) will be happy to know that the wonderful reviews of Ranger almost universally use the word "inspirational" to describe the story, and love the fact that it teaches an important lesson about self-confidence and the importance of believing in yourself.

In our house, as in  many others we're sure, Candyland is a wonderful game for the youngest kids, but quickly grows old, especially with older family members. We thought it would be fun to create a new board game, based on Ranger's legend, that would be fun for the entire family. The result, SANTALAND: Ranger's Game, is now ready to enter your home as part of your annual holiday traditions. To launch SANTALAND, we have produced a limited "Preview Edition" and you have the opportunity to acquire one or more for your family. When they're gone, they're gone, so act now and you won't have to wait until next year for the next batch.

There is no risk with this project. The limited edition batch of games has already been produced and they are ready to be shipped directly to you, arriving BEFORE Christmas!

The perks for this project include all of the other elements in the Ranger Collection: the critically acclaimed book, the CD, and the soft toy. If you don't already have these now is a good time to get them as part of this promotional project. Be sure to check out the available combinations at different contribution levels.

We're launching this project over Black Friday/Cyber Monday weekend, so act fast if you want one of the very limited quantity "door buster" early bird specials.

One more thing: the Ranger Collection is just one of the "Creative Products Supporting Worthy Causes" available from Opus One Studios. Every Opus One Studios product has an associated "beneficiary" organization that receives 100% of the profits from the sale of that product. The beneficiary for all things Ranger, including SANTALAND, is the Children's Cancer Center at Mass General Hospital in Boston, so you will get a "twofer" by backing this project!

THE GAME

Ranger's story takes place in SANTALAND which is also the setting for the game. Ranger's job is hauling newly made toys from the Workshop to the Warehouse. Toys are the focus of the game 

as well. Players act as Santa's helper elves and help load Santa's sleigh. Their job is to select a letter from a child on Santa's Nice List and pull the toys the child has asked Santa to bring them from the Warehouse. Each "Dear Santa" card has four toys to be obtained. The first player to pick all four toys on the card is the winner. For the shortest game, each player selects on child's letter (4 toys to be obtained). For longer games, each play chooses two cards (8 toys).

Players roll dice and mover their pawns the indicated number of spaces. When they land on a gift token, they pull a gift (face down) from the Warehouse. If it matches one on their Dear Santa card(s), the place the toy on the matching space. When they land on a "Naughty or Nice" symbol, they draw a card from the N&N stack and follow the instructions. If it's a Naughty card (red background) they may lose a toy or a turn. If it's a Nice card (green background) they may get an extra toy or something equally good will happen to them.

Children of all ages enjoy the game of SANTALAND, as do parents and grandparents.

story:
The Revolutionary Dice On Ice Ring - Featuring Stainless Steel Construction Tempered Glass and Hand Selected Imported Crystals. Back Joe's Campaign and get Your Very Own Dice Ring Just Select - Reward Perk Dice On Ice 777 Limited Edition Ring

*** Every Dice On Ice Ring we sell we will be donating a percentage of the sales to charities for Homeless & Abused Women & Children ( we will be having an  open ongoing discussion  with our backers on the charities and the percentage amount of the Donations ) We Wish To Give Back To The Families Who Need Critical Help In This Area and Build Dice On Ice Into A Successful Company That Helps Those Most In Need ***


Changing the Rules - There is reason dice have been around for thousands of years....Dice are exciting, unpredictable and loads of fun.Shooting Craps has always been played on a flat surface or at the craps pit in a casino Until Now That Is.....Dice On Ice 777, it's The First Ever Ring that actually Roll's It's Very Own Pair Of Dice! Dice On Ice lets you Shoot Craps inside The Ring Itself....Roll a Pair Of Snake Eye's Anytime, Anywhere .....it's Revolutionary It's " Dice On Ice " get yours today


*Featured Reward Perk - The First Twenty-Five Backers to Dice On Ice 777 Get The Dice On Ice 777 Ring ( Limited Edition ) for Only $ 25.00 Includes Free Shipping Anywhere Within The United States*


The Dice On Ice 777 Ring is also just perfect for people who cant sit still. Many folks suffer from nervous fidgeting and we wanted to offer those who suffer from this a fun and challenging way to pass time when they can not figure out what to do with their hands. The Dice On Ice Ring is always with you anytime, anyplace no matter where you are; it's now possible to enjoy dice play and the hours of enjoyment that come with it!

If you know of a friend or loved one  who might benefit from the ring's therapeutic qualities order one and give it as a  gift!


Dave Pratt Double Wide Radio Personality Introduces Joe Mangione and His Revolutionary Dice On Ice Ring to the Entire World On 1/20/15



It's Simple - Just shake your finger and watch the dice tumble and roll, its that simple. You can play  all the traditional dice games, or you can use your ring to play your favorite board games! You can use the Revolutionary Dice On Ice Ring anyway you choose.


Imagine -Just Imagine your family and friend's reaction when you flash your very own Dice On Ice 777 Ring. Everyone will be amazed.... you'll be the envy of all your friends and the center of attention.



The " Dice On Ice 777 " Ring features Exquisite Stainless Steel Construction

  •   Stainless Steel Dice

  •   Watch Crystal Quality Glass Panels

  •   Hand Selected Crystal's

  •   It's the first and only dice rolling ring

    •   Copyrighted Design

    •   To Order just select a Ring Reward in Perks       give us your ring size and use your Pay-Pal or Credit Card that's it! 




    Experience - Joe Mangione a master jeweler with twenty five years of experience and myself James Towner with twenty five years in product design and sourcing, wished to bring the dice gaming experience to everyone whenever and wherever they choose.In designing the revolutionary Dice On Ice 777 ring we have done just that.


    Every time we show the prototype of the Dice On Ice 777 Ring to our friends and family everyone wants one it is amazing, peoples reaction is always I want that ring! Now You and everyone else can have their very own Dice On Ice 777 ring



    Want To Impress-Your friends and family? Then select our Dice On Ice 777 Ring created in Sterling Silver ( 925 ) including Genuine Diamonds, or even better yet choose our Amazing  14 kt Gold Dice On Ice 777 Ring Model which of course also features Diamonds! Available in traditional Gold or if you prefer white Gold



    We welcome you to check out all our Perks and see the terrific selection of Rewards!


    It's Up To You-Enjoy dice rolling with your very own Dice On Ice 777 Ring choose the reward that suits you the best and Thank You So Very Much for Supporting Us Here At Dice On Ice 777, from The Entire Dice On Ice Family.



    Imagine.....


    You can Roll 11's on a Plane.....


    Box Car's in a Train.........


    Or even 7's in the Heaven's ............



    The Sky's The Limit .....With the Dice On Ice 777 Ring!


    Choose Dice On Ice 777 Your Own Way  Available In Stainless Steel - Sterling Silver -10 kt Gold / White Gold - 14 kt Gold /White Gold


    Note the Dice On Ice 777 Ring features precison engineering the dice themselves are exactly sized and balanced, the dice are enclosed within tempered glass and roll freely above the bed of crystals or diamonds if you prefer.


    In coming up with the Concept for Dice On Ice Joe Mangione master jeweler from Fountain Hills Arizona felt there was a real need for a geniune Dice ring, one that really was able to roll dice. 


    Joe having grown up in Las Vegas is uniquely qualified to design and engineer  Dice On Ice, he understands the gaming business and felt there was a market for the ring, a dice ring that you could play anytime and anyplace.


    Most all the rings in the marketplace today that are called " Dice Rings " are really dice rings in name only and they are fine to wear but that's all. If you do a search on Google under dice rings you will see one after another rings that have a single dice on top of the body of the ring, or if your really lucky you might find a ring with two dice atop a ring.



    Example of traditional Dice Ring prior to Dice On Ice 777



    Dice On Ice is engineered and built to the highest quality available the original ring was painstakingly refined for more than seven years. The ring itself is not only beautiful it's also an exquisite example of form as well as function. Enjoy authentic dice play anytime anyplace


    Revolutionary Design never before has a ring featured dice you can actually roll



    Our next step after coming up with the Dice On Ice 777 ring concept was the design of the ring first on paper and then precise rendering of the ring in CAD, the next step was to engineer the ring using the Matrix Revo 540 mill this amazing machine carves away the wax model material in precise movement taking hours and hours to get to this (see image of ring model below) Our Wax Master.It is now ready to send to our manufacturer for them to use to create the master tooling enabling us to produce the ring in quanity after backers such as yourself help us to make the " Dice On Ice " ring dream come true!


    The Final Ring Model After Being Precision Carved On The Matrix Revo 540 mill



    We already have the design, we have arranged for quality manufacturing all that remains, is for us to through Indiegogo.com and with your support secure funding to open The Production Tooling with the factory so that the ring can be produced (The tooling is the single largest expense) We also wish to fund and build inventory as the factory requires CIA (Cash In Advance) payment for the Production Tooling and for the initial Order for 1,000 Rings. Finally we wish to fund our website development, product packaging design and packaging inventory and provide our backers and customers with the finest ring we can possibly create. The Tooling for the ring is the single largest expense at well over $ 14,000.



    The Matrix Revo 540 Is Our Secret Weapon It Enables Us To Manufacture The " Dice On Ice 777 " Ring To Exacting Standards....The Ring You Will Receive Will Be Exquisite In It's Detail And Overall Quality



    Perk's


    In closing please select one of our several reward Perks and we sincerely appreciate your support ...to help us at Dice On Ice 777 bring our gaming dice ring to the entire world!


    For only $ 2 Back Us at Dice On Ice 777 and receive a thank you e-mail from Joe ! many thanks


    For only $ 11 you can support Dice on Ice 777 and at the same time choose a very nice set of  Dice On Ice dice in your choice of either Pink , Blue or Red Acrylic! thank You....


    For just $ 20 You can be one of the first owners of the first ever Dice On Ice 777 Logo T-Shirt! Please specify either M or XL. Wear It in good health!


    For just $ 25 select our Featured Perk  you can get your very own Dice On Ice 777 Ring including ( Free Shipping Anywhere in the USA ) so make sure you are one of the first 25 backers and select the Limited Edition Dice On Ice 777 Ring in the Featured Perk section.




    Perk Blue Dice $ 12 Dice Reward 


    Perk Pink Dice $ 12 Dice Reward 


    Perk Red Dice $ 12 Dice Reward


    Many Thanks From The Dice On Ice 777 Family .....

story:
Choose any perk and click the add-on list, you'll see the "Lucky Bag"

 

 

  • Inspired by Mars immigration

Humanity has explored Mars since 1960, landing probes that collect valuable data and sending back images that inspire the imagination. The next logical step for Mars exploration is a permanent settlement, where crews travel to Mars and stay to build a new society. The founder and designer of The Pioneer Dice firmly believes that humanity will move to another planet in the future, and Mars is the most likely destination.

That’s the inspiration for The Pioneer Dice set. It is the world’s first Mars settlement themed metallic polyhedral dice collection. The dice set is handcrafted, with incredible precision and intricate details, a combination of futuristic design and tactile function, inspiring dreams of space exploration.

 

Each dice is created with solid and durable Zinc Alloy casting and all are meticulously hand-painted in vivid colors. We have spared no effort in designing and testing the dice to make sure they are fair and balanced for all your board games. The Pioneer Dice are the perfect companion for every exciting game night.

 

 

The dice box is carefully crafted to look exactly like Mars, the planet that inspired it. It’s the perfect place to safely store the dice between games. The dice box does not need a bracket, it is made to stand on its own like a dice tumbler.

The protective pad is custom designed by our lead designer, and is unique to anything on the market. The pad is a necessary part of any board game, helping you roll the dice in a balanced and fair way, so you can better enjoy your game.
story_txt:
Choose any perk and click the add-on list, you'll see the "Lucky Bag"  Inspired by Mars immigrationHumanity has explored Mars since 1960, landing probes that collect valuable data and sending back images that inspire the imagination. The next logical step for Mars exploration is a permanent settlement, where crews travel to Mars and stay to build a new society. The founder and designer of The Pioneer Dice firmly believes that humanity will move to another planet in the future, and Mars is the most likely destination.That’s the inspiration for The Pioneer Dice set. It is the world’s first Mars settlement themed metallic polyhedral dice collection. The dice set is handcrafted, with incredible precision and intricate details, a combination of futuristic design and tactile function, inspiring dreams of space exploration. 

 
 Each dice is created with solid and durable Zinc Alloy casting and all are meticulously hand-painted in vivid colors. We have spared no effort in designing and testing the dice to make sure they are fair and balanced for all your board games. The Pioneer Dice are the perfect companion for every exciting game night.
 
  
   
 
 
 The dice box is carefully crafted to look exactly like Mars, the planet that inspired it. It’s the perfect place to safely store the dice between games. The dice box does not need a bracket, it is made to stand on its own like a dice tumbler.
 
 
 The protective pad is custom designed by our lead designer, and is unique to anything on the market. The pad is a necessary part of any board game, helping you roll the dice in a balanced and fair way, so you can better enjoy your game.

story:
We are glad you are interested in our product.

 

Why would I support this campaign?

1) By supporting us, you support T9A as a whole.

2) Taking part in the project brings you exclusive supporters’ rewards.

3) You will be among first to get new miniatures

By now, we have made concept and models for 8 units that we are ready to finalize should we reach our primary goal.

We do not want to stop there, though. We have also prepared additional goals that depend on what we raise. If, thanks to you, we get beyond the primary goal, we will start manufacturing more models until we make ALL the units from The Vermin Swarm Army Book.

    The Vermin Swarm Grenadiers 

    The Vermin Swarm Jezails 

    The Vermin Swarm Giant Rats

    The Vermin Swarm Vermin Hulks

    The Vermin Swarm Thunder Hulks

    The Vermin Swarm Naphtha Launcher

    The Vermin Swarm Rotary Gun

    The Vermin Swarm Meat Grinder

    The Vermin Swarm Globe Launcher

    The Vermin Abomination

    The Vermin Swarm Rakachit Machinist

    The Vermin Swarm Plague Brotherhood​

    What do I get for supporting the campaign?

    1. We will create an account for you on Lubart-miniatures.com using the email you used for pledging or any other you want.
    2. We will credit your account with the amount equal to your pledge. You can spend it in our Webstore at any moment for ANY miniatures our company sells. If you do not want The Vermin Swarm miniatures, you can simply wait until other armies are released and spend your credit then.
    3. You will get a PERMANENT discount in Lubart Miniatures Webstore.
    4. Additional rewards are granted, depending on the size of your pledge.

    Please note!

    • We are only able to ship your models in a month after the campaign is over.
    • Postage expenses are not included

    Postage:

    Standard mail – 5 € to any country. Delivery may take 1-2 months.

    EMS – 17 € within Europe. Usually delivered within a week.

    EMS for the USA – 25 €

    EMS for Canada – 25 €

     

    EMS for Austarlia – 25 €

story:
GOP: A Game of Political Survival
 

Tread all over the USA and escape Washington gridlock before mysterious weather disturbances swallow you up! Roll the dice to survive climate change and political scandal. To make the lengthy journey to Alaska, you’ll need plenty of fossil fuel and rugged individualism. Roads and bridges? PFFT!

If the country seems backwards to you, don’t compromise – just move farther to the right!

Super PAC Cards send you forward and help you collect barrels of fossil fuel.
     

    

But don't have a Change of Heart!
     

   

Make it to Alaska before climate change gets you!

Tell me what you think, or better yet buy a copy and I can set my friend Kelsie up with some sweet art supplies.

Thanks a million!

- Woody

story:
UPDATE: Even if the campaign has ended here, you can continue to purchase the game in our home page!

UPDATE: All backers that have pledged until 27.4. will get the game in email during the day! We will also extend the campaign by two weeks and every weekend will send out the game to all new backers! Thank you for all who have purchased!

UPDATE: Game will be released 27.4.2020 - all backers will receive the game regardless of goal status!

Do you love puzzles, escape rooms and mysteries? Are you looking for ways to have fun and connect with your loved ones while the global pandemic keeps you physically apart? We have just the game for you!

We are Ludum Effugium, a brand new company set out to create escape room style puzzle solving games. One of our favorite things about escape rooms is the social aspect of working together to solve a mystery, and we wanted to find a way to help people experience that while respecting social distancing guidelines.

Memory Mystery is our first game. It’s a two-player game each player can play in the safety of their own home. Both players get a set of documents they’re not allowed to show each other, and they must find a way to solve a set of puzzles together. No experience in video games required! Try out our tutorial!

Teaser of materials for Player 2

Who are we? Our journey begins in the University of Helsinki, in Southern Finland. Two college students meet at a student organization dedicated to the social roleplaying game Assassin and end up running the group together for a decade. Later on we start creating puzzle games for our friends, who love our games and keep encouraging us to distribute them to a larger audience. We join forces with a third friend, and Ludum Effugium is born.

Locks in browser based system

Memory Mystery is only our first game; we have plenty more in mind. We would love to create a game for kids, a four player game and a special game for the Holiday season. You can support our journey by purchasing Memory Mystery and encourage us to go on!

Keys to many mysteries lie on the table...

story:
The Geneva Cavern Mini-setting

Cover for this book is pictured above

This is the Third campaign for Eddie Jonas Forgotten Dungeon adventure series. These adventures are designed for 5e, AD&D, and WCS game systems such as Dragonscales and 77 Worlds. This campaign will help us print the Geneva Cavern booklet which includes 8 mini-adventures along with details on each area within the Genevia Caverns. We are also offering the Monster Folio book with 300+ encounters.

If you did not participate in the prior campaigns, below is an image of the five modules we have published. You can acquire these as addon's at the end of the campaign or from firesidecreations.com at any time.

The five mega adventures that started it all off are pictured below

What We Need & What You Get

The creative work is complete. Now we are raising funds to produce the PDF's and the physical books. Your support will help bring this project to life. We will produce the Geneva Cavern Book which contains 8 mini-adventures and the details about each area on the cavern. We will also produce large print maps created by Darlene as pictured on the cover below, and we will produce the Monster Folio that details over 300 monsters for use with your games from the five Forgotten Dungeon mega modules.

The cover for the Monster Folio

Risks & Challenges

Really, there are none to speak of. We have the art and the creative work in place. The Cartography for the Geneva Cavern is done and the small maps for the 8 mini-adventures are all underway. Once the campaign funds, we will send everything to the printer and then ship it to all our backers. Backers will receive a survey after the campaign ends where they will be able to pay for shipping and add any extras, including any of the prior 5 mega-modules, to their rewards before products are shipped.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Like the campaign? You can also help by spreading the word. Help let others know this campaign is underway so we can raise enough funds to produce high quality books.

story:
Add flavor, drama, and a bit of comedy to your campaign with the Deck of Surprises. These original magical items and effects can be doled out by the DM as treasure, drawn at random to determine a magical effect, or given to the players to be used like the Deck of Many Things. The Deck of Surprises is compatible with DND 5e and made for all levels/tiers of play. Featuring 104 brand new magical items and effects.  

Many of these items/effects have been play-tested over the past 5 years around the gaming table, so we can guarantee the value that they add to any campaign. Some items/effects are a straight-up bummer of a curse (like Narcolepsy – where the character falls asleep every time they roll a natural 1), whereas some are awesome surprises that anyone would kill for (like Emmet’s Watch, which transports the party 24 hours into the past). Most are a blessing and a curse rolled into one, like Awesome Blood which gives your blood magical healing properties for anyone who drinks it. Which is… good? Maybe?

These sturdy, tarot-sized cards feature unique, hand-drawn art. Card details:

· Tarot Card Sized (70mm x 120mm)

· Gloss varnish

· Coreless Plus 350 GSM cardstock - a lovely heavy cardstock for that luxury feel

· Tuck box 

Production deets

The list of items/effects and card artwork are currently being created and play tested. We’ve already secured our printer (the amazing PrintNinja) and are working with a professional fulfilment service so that our backers will receive their decks as soon as they roll off the production line. We are hoping to have these cards printed and shipped so that they start to arrive in our backers' mailboxes by the end of May or early June. 

Stretch Goals

Our stretch goals included the creation of more cards for the Deck of Surprises – which increased the total potential number of cards from the original 80 up to to 104!  

Check out our stretch goals below:

*UNLOCKED* $9,000 Goal: 6 more cards added to the deck (total of 86 cards)

*UNLOCKED* $12,000 Goal: 6 more cards added to the deck (total of 92 cards)

*UNLOCKED*  $16,000 Goal: 6 more cards added to the deck (for a new total of 98 cards)

*UNLOCKED*   $22,000 Goal: 6 more cards added to the deck (for a new total of 104 cards)

About us

Outside the Lines Press is a family-owned publishing company in Nova Scotia. The owners (husband and wife team of Justin and Ranke) have been involved in the DND scene for many years, having operated a series of DND Youth Workshops in 2018 which were funded by the Culture Innovation Fund of the Government of Nova Scotia. The team involved in The Deck of Surprises include players and Dungeon Masters that have been involved with DND since the 1980s. This ain’t our first rodeo.  The folks behind The Deck of Surprises have been involved in the successful launch of a number of crowdfunded projects, including the children's picture book Fancy Goat, the parody book A Coloring Book for Married People, and the children's album Critical Hit from Bingly and The Rogues.

story:
Sometimes, the most stimulating game comes from the simplest challenge. 

Threepia explores the realm of our mind, color, and shape to create a simple stimulating puzzle card game that transcends both age and languages.

Threepia is a game for everyone – together at a party or alone at home. The game is with both multiplayer and single-player in mind.

 

The gameplay

Threepia trains the eyes and challenges the mind with its simple color and shape puzzle. You can learn to play the game within minutes and be engrossed for hours. 
 

 

One game, many ways to play

Threepia's gameplay expands beyond the layout of the square gird. There are many alternative game grids to start with, adding new challenges and fun.

The simple intuitive mechanic of the game allows the player to explore and create different starting grids, adding a new dimension to the gameplay for the creative mind. 

 

Solo or with friends, you are free to choose

You can play in a group of up to 6 people, have a 1 on 1 challenge with your child and friend, or play as an individual player to best your personal time score, Threepia is the one game that lets you do them all.

2 or more people

Score-challenge: It can be 15, 20, or even 30 points, you set the end score, whoever hits the score first, wins!

Turn-challenge:  Set the number of turns, whoever hits the highest score at the end of all the turns, wins!

Deck-challenge: Whoever has the highest score when the deck finishes, wins!

Clock-challenge: At the start of each turn, the player sets a 30 seconds countdown using a timer (mobile phone) or a sand-timer and try to score as many points as possible within the timing, before moving onto the next player. When the deck finishes, the player with the highest score wins!

Time-challenge: Everyone gets their mobile phone timer ready! Each player is given a total of 3 mins for the entire game. Inspired by International Chess, respective players start their individual countdown at the start of their turn and pause the timer at the end of their turn, the countdown resumes when it's come around to the same player. The game ends for the player when their clock runs out, while others continue to finish the game with their remaining time. When the time runs out for everyone, the player with the highest score wins!

 

Individual challenge

Time-challenge: Ready the timer, get set, go! Finish the deck and best your own timing! Excellent training for the mind – young and old. 

 

Product Spec

Actual color and packaging may vary little

 

Game Instructions

The game instructions will be folded and fit into the box. When fully open, the sheet will be 280 x 280mm.*You can preview the layout via the below link

http://www.threepia.com/resource_instruction/ThreepiaGameRulesEnVer1.pdf

* size of the sheet may change due to design enhancement

 

Online Goodies (officially available after mid-march)1. Special online game timer for Threepia Time-challenge. Supports up to 6 players, check it out on http://threepia.com/timer/ 
2. Game instructions in various languages

English:
http://www.threepia.com/resource_instruction/ThreepiaGameRulesEnVer1.pdf

Dutch:
http://www.threepia.com/resource_instruction/ThreepiaGameRulesEnVer1.pdf

French:
http://www.threepia.com/resource_instruction/ThreepiaGameRulesFRVer1.pdf 

German:
http://www.threepia.com/resource_instruction/ThreepiaGameRulesDEVer1.pdf  

Spanish:
http://www.threepia.com/resource_instruction/ThreepiaGameRulesESVer1.pdf 

 

3. Printable PDF Score Sheets for some of our gameplay

story:
Short Summary

  • We are Valor Infinity Studios, LLC (www.valorinfinitystudios.com), a group of individuals (over half veterans) that love gaming. We created Valor Infinity: The Role-Playing game and we are proud to bring you Escape Da Box.
  • This campaign is important because it will help us get the first run of Escape Da Box printed and out to people.
  • Contributors help us bring this game to production, we can't do it without you.

What We Need & What You Get

•Currently we are working on funding this preliminary goblin deck of “Escape DA box”.

•This deck will be 162 cards.

•This deck supports Up to six players, so you kill up to five of your friends (for fun sickos).

•Retail for $20.00.

•Depending on the crowd funding we will release support card deck to track attribute points.

•Goal is to release additional deck types that can be mixed with the initial goblin deck.

The Impact

  • This is a fun and competitive strategic game with a twisted sense of humor.
  • It is based off of the Valor Infinity Role-Playing Gaming line.
  • This has been in the works for the last couple of years. We've put our tabletop RPG on hold to get this game out. 

Risks & Challenges

  • We have a dynamic team of individuals including several veterans that are used to working in a high demand field. Our goal is to provide a fun dynamic game that allows you to beat the crap out of your friends (within the game) while laughing at each others misfortunes. It uses laughter to bring people together.
  • We need to raise enough money to order at least 1,000 decks. We are starting by launching this Indiegogo campaign.  

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you can't contribute, please share this campaign with other people. We need your help!

What is Escape Da Box?

• Escape DA Box is a brutal game of sabotage and destruction. You play a curious goblin that explored the wrong cardboard box and is trapped until you either die or take out the other players in an attempt to escape. Up to six players enter, but only one player leaves.

•Each player picks a player card. This card has unique attributes and a unique ability. This card represents the player.

•Attributes

•1. Guts – Courage 

•2. Moxie - Smarts

•3. Spunk – Life Stuff

•If any one of your attributes reach 0 (zero), your Goblin player is unable to continue their escape and you’re a loser. 

•If any of your attributes reach 21 (twenty-one), your Goblin explodes appropriately in relation to the exceeded stat and you’re a loser.

You have to be smart in how you lose/gain points as you also use your attribute points to cast/summon certain cards. Last Goblin standing escapes the box.

Card game is for entertainment purposes only, we do not condone the card actions in real life. This game is meant for mature audiences.

Short Summary

We are Valor Infinity Studios, LLC (www.valorinfinitystudios.com), a group of individuals (over half veterans) that love gaming. We created Valor Infinity: The Role-Playing game and we are proud to bring you Escape Da Box.
This campaign is important because it will help us get the first run of Escape Da Box printed and out to people.
Contributors help us bring this game to production, we can't do it without you.


What We Need & What You Get
•Currently we are working on funding this preliminary goblin deck of “Escape DA box”.
•This deck will be 162 cards.
•This deck supports Up to six players, so you kill up to five of your friends (for fun sickos).
•Retail for $20.00.
•Depending on the crowd funding we will release support card deck to track attribute points.
•Goal is to release additional deck types that can be mixed with the initial goblin deck.

The Impact

This is a fun and competitive strategic game with a twisted sense of humor.
It is based off of the Valor Infinity Role-Playing Gaming line.
This has been in the works for the last couple of years. We've put our tabletop RPG on hold to get this game out. 


Risks & Challenges

We have a dynamic team of individuals including several veterans that are used to working in a high demand field. Our goal is to provide a fun dynamic game that allows you to beat the crap out of your friends (within the game) while laughing at each others misfortunes. It uses laughter to bring people together.
We need to raise enough money to order at least 1,000 decks. We are starting by launching this Indiegogo campaign.  


Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't contribute, please share this campaign with other people. We need your help!
What is Escape Da Box?• Escape DA Box is a brutal game of sabotage and destruction. You play a curious goblin that explored the wrong cardboard box and is trapped until you either die or take out the other players in an attempt to escape. Up to six players enter, but only one player leaves.•Each player picks a player card. This card has unique attributes and a unique ability. This card represents the player.•Attributes•1. Guts – Courage •2. Moxie - Smarts•3. Spunk – Life Stuff•If any one of your attributes reach 0 (zero), your Goblin player is unable to continue their escape and you’re a loser. •If any of your attributes reach 21 (twenty-one), your Goblin explodes appropriately in relation to the exceeded stat and you’re a loser.You have to be smart in how you lose/gain points as you also use your attribute points to cast/summon certain cards. Last Goblin standing escapes the box.Card game is for entertainment purposes only, we do not condone the card actions in real life. This game is meant for mature audiences.

story:
Spears & Spells

Spears & Spells is a streamlined, OSR-ish tabletop roleplaying game designed to get you telling fantastic stories with your friends in no time. It's easy to play, easy to run, and suitable for any fantasy setting, from heroic to gritty. 

Heroic Yet Simple

We wanted a game that was fast, simple, and transparent. Spears & Spells is designed to help the characters be heroes without needing a half-dozen rulebooks containing hundreds of pages of confusing rules. The math is balanced to be slightly in the characters’ favor, though it’s still pretty easy for them to die if they’re not careful.

Every Die is a d6

From initial stat generation to damage dice, nothing in Spears & Spells uses any die but a d6. Having a half dozen d6s handy is a good idea.

Tasks

To determine outcomes players roll dice based on their character stats.  These rolls are called Tasks. The Ref works together with the player to determine which stat governs the Task, though the Ref makes the final decision. You roll some six-sided dice, hoping the total is under that stat. If it is, you succeed!

Customized Characters

Spears & Spells is classless, and it uses levels. Characters choose Talents at creation and level-up. How you choose Talents lets you custom-tailor your character so they can do precisely what you want them to do.

Fail-Forward

Spears & Spells uses "fail-forward" techniques when a Task roll doesn't come up a success. Rather than failure stopping the game in its tracks, it complicates matters and makes the session more interesting!

Stretch Goals

$2250 - We'll add a form-fillable PDF character sheet custom-designed for Spears & Spells to make your life easier.

$2500+ - When we hit this goal - and every $250 we hit after that - we'll get a talented indie adventure writer to create another Spears & Spells adventure. If we get enough, we'll make a completely separate book of adventures, and you'll get two books instead of just one!

Who Are We? 

 

 

Kabouter Games is a pico-publisher of tabletop role-playing games and adventures, creators of Toxandria, the FIRST complete game released under Chaosium Inc's Basic Roleplaying OGL! 

Kabouter Games creates adventures, GM support materials, stuff for players, and more!

Chief Kabouter R P Davis is a veteran RPG freelancer who's written and edited for a passel of pico-publishers, as well as bigger names like Kobold Press, Cubicle 7, Loresmyth, Onyx Path, and Wizards of the Coast. It was only a matter of time before he started his own thing.

What We Need & What You Get

The State of the Project: The rulebook and initial adventure are written, playtested, and ready for editing and layout. Your pledge helps us pay for editing and layout.

Digital Copies Delivery: PDF copies will ship via DriveThruRPG as soon as layout is completed. That way you'll always have your copy in your DTRPG Library!

Print Copies Delivery: Print copies will be printed and shipped via DriveThruRPG. Backers will receive a discount coupon, allowing them to receive their softcover book for the cost of printing and shipping. You can check estimated print cost here (about 60 pages, black & white interior), and shipping costs here. This method helps insure prompt delivery to most places on the planet.

Risks & Challenges

There is not a lot that can go wrong at this point. Please note that the global pandemic has had an impact on shipping, and that might mean shipping delays for physical books.

Your Impact

Your contribution will make the difference between Spears & Spells remaining a dream and having it see the light of day. Your support will also help us help other indie creators in these trying times by hiring them to work on the project.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, it's okay! Times are hard. You can still help us succeed!

  • Get the word out; make some noise about our campaign on social media
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools

We love and appreciate you!
