story:
Sock Monsters - a Card Game For Creative Kids

Hi, we are Sam and Rotem, Rotem and Sam, the two grown-up sock monsters.

We are parents, game-designers, game players and teachers.

After many years working in the digital game world, Sock Monsters is our first physical card game for children. It is also our first crowdfunding project.

 

The story of Sock Monsters started as an idea for parents and for children to share a creative experience.  We wanter families to use the basic story as a starter for creating their own stories. We had  many tries and errors in the way we presented the Sock Monsters story. Eventually, we made the story into a card game because we believe in active story telling, where children can create their own plot and change it with every single round of play.

The Sock Monsters is also about diversity: there are 10 of them, each with their own unique character. They do have one thing in common though: their passion for socks.  

The game is quite simple: deal 5 cards per player; start drawing cards from the deck; get a monster to start collecting socks; win by collecting 5 socks of the same color.

Here is our tutorial:

 

What Do You Get When You Back The Project?

Why, you get the game!

Every perk in this project offers you a way to get the game. If you want to contribute some money, but you don't want to get the printed game, you can get the downloadable version. It doubles as a coloring book, so you can paint your own card game!

If you want to get the printed game, and it is well worth the wait, we offer the main perk. Early birds will get the best offer on the price of the game.

For those who want to group, to get the game for a better price (and for international backers: for a better group shipment fee) - there is the 3 game package perk.

 

Why Do We Need Your Support?

With your support, we can achieve the goal of producing our first card game. Your contribution means that we will be able to manufacture and ship the first edition of Sock Monsters. It will also mean that our concept will receive business validation.

 

What We Need

We ask for a funding of $12,000, to help us create the first edition of the game.

With this budget, we will be able to:

  • Manufacture the first 1,000 copies of the game, with the help of the good people of Ad Magic
  • We will be able to store the copies and ship the game packages with the help of our friends at ShipBob
  • We will be able to finance the transaction fees, the accountancy, Indiegogo commissions and the logistics of running this campaign, with the experts at BackerKit 
  • If we exceed the goal, we will be able to print more games, and allocate more funds for fulfillment.  We will also be able to create more products and create more games under g!animo

 

We decided to set a fixed goal for our campaign, so that if we do not succeed, the money will be returned to the backers.

The goal we set for this campaign is the basic amount of money required to manufacture the game and pay all of the costs. We need to meet this goal if we want to make the Sock Monster game come true at the quality you deserve.

A Game That Socks

After many years in the gaming industry and as startup entrepreneurs, we slowly developed a concept for story-based games and experiences. We called it g!animo. Sock Monsters is the first game under this concept. 

We started g!animo as a fun project several years ago. We wanted to create a different way to let parents and children tell stories. This is why we created stories and characters and printed them on wall decals. It didn't go very well, but we didn't let it get us down. We started playing with one of the stories, Sock Monsters, and it soon found its own direction: a card game.

It took us several months, over 200 playtests and many drafts and sketches, to declare the design of the first version as done.

Sock Monsters is the first attempt in creating a game from one of our 4 different children's stories. Its success will mean that we can develop more games and more activities out of these stories. It means the world to us. 

 

The Story

When Granny Yarn, the wrinkliest sock monster in Under-The-Bed-Town, gathered all the young sock monsters together for a bedtime story, little did she know how much trouble it would cause.  

She opened her great book of legends to the very last tale, and told a story she hadn’t told for a very long time. It was the legend of Draweria – a mythical land where bright clean socks are laid in pairs – as many as a sock monster could ever eat. Stripy ones and spotty ones, frilly ones and fluffy ones – Draweria had them all! 


The young sock monsters drooled at the thought. “Wow,” gasped William. “Can we go there?” “Of course not” said MathU. “It’s just a story. It’s highly improbable it even exists.” “Let’s go anyway!” cried Yum and Mee. “No-one is going anywhere tonight!” said Granny Yarn. “Goodnight little monsters.” she blew them kisses and turned off the light. But the little sock monsters were too excited to sleep. 
“Frilly socks,” sighed Lola, “I’ve always wanted to be frilly.” 
Here, we should probably explain that whenever a sock-monster gobbles up a sock, they immediately take on the appearance of the sock they have just eaten.
Boo, is all inside-out and smelly after eating a dirty old sock by mistake. “I think we should leave immediately.” He said. 
“Me Too!” said one of Molly’s heads. “Me Three!” said the other. And so they all set out with only the words of Granny Yarn’s book to guide them:

״Through the valley of the toys,

Go towards the tick-tock noise.

Cross the rug a mile wide,

Climb the cupboard’s slippery side.

And when peggies come in site,

Don’t let them give you a fright.״

 

The Plan

When we meet the goal, or hopefully exceed it, we will be able to manufacture the game at Ad Magic's facility. The funds collected will also finance the shipment to backers in the US. International backers will have to add the difference for shipment when backing the project. 

The funds we request are only the funds required to manufacture and to ship the product. Here is how the funds will be allocated when we just meet the goal:

If we will exceed the requested goal, the pie chart will change: a larger percentage will be allocated for fulfillment, we will also be able to cover other expenses, and of course: we may even have enough funds to create more products and to manufacture further editions of the game. 

 

 

Tell Us What You Think

We would really love your support: not just in backing our project, but also in spreading the word, sharing the project in social media or within you closed group.

We are open to suggestions and to criticism. If you think we can improve any part of our project, please tell us and we'll respond as quickly as possible.
